description:
This is one of my favorite spots in the city. Close to Golden Gate Park, and in a quiet neighborhood, it always seems quite busy.

The coffee is always hot and the food is delicious. I would recommend their egg sandwiches on a croissant, the breakfast burrito or their huge, fresh mixed salad. The portions are great and it's very reasonably priced.
It's also the perfect little spot to sit outside or by the window with a good book. Very friendly staff!!
Would HIGHLY recommend with a solid 5 stars!!!
author: Jessica N.

description:
Velo Rouge is a cute cafe near Golden Gate Park, with some great brunch food available. I came here with a friend after a night out, and boy were we relieved by the generous portions and tasty food. 

Atmosphere - it has a really European vibe with a cute feel. We saw many people studying and eating, with the occasional person coming in for some takeout coffee. The staff is really nice, and the food arrived pretty quickly. 

Food - my friend got the breakfast sandwich on a croissant, which he said was delicious. I got the breakfast burrito, which was humongous for its price and delicious. It had everything in it, from eggs to cheese to avocado and a side of chips as well. The burrito is really filling, and I could only eat one half before I was full. It creates a great second meal as well. 

All in all, I definitely recommend this little cafe. You can take a nice walk in Golden Gate Park after as well. Definitely come here if you're around!
author: Will W.

description:
Two words: Breakfast Burrito. 

Made with real eggs. Beans. Avocado. Salsa. Sour cream. All the good stuff. 

I always add sausage or bacon, but it's plenty big without. 

The rest of the menu looks great, but I have yet to find the courage to step away from the breakfast burrito. 

As for aesthetics, cool art, cool chairs, cool staff, and all around cool vibe as this funky little corner cafe.
author: Michael S.

description:
Walked over to this spot before heading into the Park for a nice relaxing day in the sun. Was immediately feeling the good vibes when walking in, and employees there could tell it was my first time. Start recommending a few different breakfast sandwiches and the way I could modify them.

I went with the Mt. Ventoux Breakfast Sandwich and then had them add avocado to it, which makes most things better (Dont @ me). It was absolutely delicious and I would recommend for anyone who is a big breakfast sammy fan.
author: Isaiah W.

description:
They consistently deliver a goooood cup of almond milk latte. It's steamed perfectly and it's hot and flavorful. Also, their bagels are good (though slightly expensive) and BREAKFAST BURRITO is so good!!!! It was the best breakfast burrito I had. Definitely get it, it's $$ but it's pretty big and I couldn't even finish one for a meal so I had a bit left for later. Also customer service is great and the people who work here are chill and I feel like they're genuinely nice. I also see the same folks all the time which makes me think that there is not a huge turnover in employees, which is a good sign. Go Velo Rouge, the neighborhood gem!

Get. The. Breakfast. Burrito.
author: Soo L.

description:
I've come here multiple times because of its convenience but the food has now proven to be clearly mediocre both in flavor and in quality and even worse is the people who provide the service here. 

BEWARE: The barista dude was incredibly arrogant and rude. 

I asked him for a to-go box and he answered 'No.' with a smirky condescending smile . Don't joke like that with a customer you haven't had a real interaction with . It is extremely off-putting . I couldn't even enjoy the rest of my drink in peace so I asked for a to-go cup only to also get a half-ass smile and get handed the cup as if saying 'Here.' in another rude gesture/body language kind of way. 

The people here do not make you feel comfortable and ultimately the food is mediocre and overpriced considering you have to clean up your dishes yourself. 

No reason to give the food or the service the benefit of the doubt and come here. 

I hope people read this genuinely and pick a different place to eat.
author: Gigi V.

description:
Cute cafe that serves some really bomb sandwiches & comes w/a side of salad!  It was so delicious.  Highly recommend! 
Ordered: the pantini (vegetarian option!) $9.30, the ullrich tuna melt  $9.30
author: Mikayla M.

description:
Busy, tiny neighborhood cafe filled with good food and coffee. 

Stopped in on a busy Sunday morning and the line wrapped around the entire interior of the cafe. There is both seating inside and outside and it seemed like most people were able to find a table to eat without having to wait too long after ordering.

Almost everyone seemed to order the breakfast burrito. When we looked around, it was the only thing we saw on every single person's plate in the cafe. We decided to change it up and both got a breakfast sandwich. I got it with a croissant and the BF tried it on an everything bagel. The sandwich was a little thin- with just the bacon, cheese and egg, but it was tasty! 

I also added a side of the potatoes and I highly recommend them! The portion was large and they were delicious with some ketchup. They were cooked perfectly with a crisp yet perfect softness. 

The coffee and espresso drinks are great here! We all got lattes and they hit the spot perfectly. They even do a little latte art on them for you. 

Overall, very busy cafe so I wouldn't stop in if you're in a huge rush, but if you're done to relax and enjoy a meal or drink, it's a great spot.
author: Courtney O.

description:
lovely brunch spot!!! Small so seating can be difficult to find during rush hour!

The staff is very friendly and their food is delicious!
author: Nathalie M.

description:
I almost didn't write this review because I thought I was just being overly sensitive, but reading other reviews it seems that strange/rude interactions are common. 

The guy behind the register seemed super nice, going out of his way to ask each person what they had planned for the day, seemingly with lots of interest and follow up questions. Not something I really need, but ok. After our extended interaction (again extended by him, not me) I went to wait for my food in the back of the small room. He then starts talking loudly with the other guy who I believe is the manager or owner about how he doesn't care at all about people's day, he just wants them to give him more money. I could not believe the volume of this conversation. The manager guy was in agreement it was a good "pick up line". I work customer service too so I get it, but maybe don't talk about how dumb you think customers are when they're standing right there. 

After a while he brought me my food to go, and said one more encouraging thing about my work day ahead. Thanks? 


Two stars instead of one only because the food is pretty good. But I won't be back. Too awkward.
author: Erin H.

description: Wanted something small and tasty for lunch. Tasty yes, small no. Nice portion sizes, friendly staff, draught beer on tap, what else would you want?
author: Peter H.

description: Was super hungry and wanted some good food. This place seemed to have solid reviews. Went inside and it was a really relaxing place to be. I have some diet restrictions and the person taking my order was super helpful and flexible with getting me some I could eat. Food came out and was absolutely delicious. Really grateful I came in.
author: Joseph L.

description:
Welcoming atmosphere once you walk into this sweet little spot. Stopped by for a quick bite because we had to hit to road back home to OC. Order at the register and grab a seat!

I was debating between the Mt. Ventoux Breakfast Sandwich and the tuna melt but opted for the Mt. Ventoux on a sesame bagel with avocado (+$1.75). The sandwich was simple enough, just as you would expect. Low-key, I wished I had ordered the tuna melt instead but I still enjoyed my bagel sandwich. Had a bite of my friend's scramble and thought it was really good!

Help yourself to water, condiments, and coffee fixings. Don't forget to clean up after yourself! They have designated bins for different kinds of trash and a cart where you leave your dirty dishes.
author: Lisa N.

description: Wow this is now one of my favorite cafes in SF. First of all, the food is AMAZING!!! Everything on the menu is delicious, and they have so much variety of food. Second, the theme of the cafe is so cute, and aesthetically pleasing. I get good vibes when I'm there. If you are biking or taking a walk around golden gate park, you should DEFINITELY stop by!
author: Maika S.

description:
'Meh' is a good way to describe my feelings about Vel Rouge Cafe. 

+ The place itself is charming.  Very quirky and quaint and quiet and an ideal place I'm sure to spend a morning working. 

But then I feel like the negatives roll in... 

- Mt. Ventoux sandwich.  Sounds like it'll be great w/ its eggs and bacon and cheese on a croissant.  What could be bad about that?  This one was so flat.  And I mean that literally.  Super thin layer of egg, slice or two of bacon and a slice of cheese.  For $6 I was expecting something a little heartier.  And I'm coming from NYC where folks live off of baconeggandcheese sandwiches in the morning and they're half the price of the one from Velo.

- Our sandwich came w/ a little helping of fruit. and I mean little.  I think my plate had one strawberry, one melon and maybe a grape?  

- Hubs ordered a coffee to combat the cool SF morning and was surprised to find that there were no refills.  And the mugs of coffee were so small.  Poor guy finished the drink in 2.5 sips...

I'm not saying Velo Rouge Cafe is bad.  It's not.  it's just overpriced for what was ordered and just kinda 'meh.'
author: Alyssa R.

description: Nice little café with good cappuccino and breakfast. We had the arguilla breakfast and homestyle oatmeal. It opens at 6:30 which was nice since we were up due to our Jetlag.
author: Hannah G.

description: Worst breakfast burrito I've ever had! I barely ate half of it. It was mostly watery salsa, black beans, and was very salty. It fell apart after taking a couple of bites and was messy. Maybe today was an off day for the chef/cook but I will never come back here. Such disappointment.
author: Nima G.

description:
Why 1 star: Guy was a real obnoxiousness up on a horse D about something so minor.  I just wanted my coffee and the way he went about serving it to me was outlandish.  I won't say what it was because it's too specific and irrelevant.  But it was rude, and arrogant as the main point.  
I saw him act this way (rock star) to everyone so it was not just me.  No one stands up for themselves such as myself because he's like the Coffee Nazi.  You just really want that coffee at all costs.  Even a nudge to your dignity.  It makes him feel like less of the loser he is to treat people this way, I figured out.  

To add and watch for this health code violation.  This D takes each cup, spins it around his hands up and down back and forth covering the part where you drink with his dirty, stinky hands.  Thank god the coffee is hot otherwise you could catch an STD from these cups.

People who think their rock-stars in their jobs.  Hair Stylist, Bar Tender, Tattoo Artist, and now Velo Rouge Barista. 

1 star for the D behind the counter.  To point him out, he's a lil over weight, under shaven, smells, and wears an old brown Upper Playground Hoodie.
author: Shawn L.

description:
Great small cafe and great coffee! Came in around 11am on a Friday and the interior dining room was packed but we were lucky enough to get one of the few outside tables. I got a drip coffee which was great (unfortunately no refills) that I fixed up at the counter with self-serve water area. The walls are lined with cool bicycle memorabilia and sharing tables is encouraged. 

My boyfriend ordered the breakfast sandwich on an English muffin that he enjoyed, but didn't find it to be anything particularly special. The sandwich comes with a side of fresh fruit. I got the breakfast burrito which was flavorful, had a great mix of ingredients and was huge! Not only was the burrito delicious but it also came with fresh tortilla chips and pico de gallo. Definitely recommend!
author: Mary S.

description: I've been in here about 5 times. The food and coffee is ALRIGHT (although expensive) but the reason I hate this place is because of the rude and stuck up staff and people that come here. People who work here and eat here are entitled, privileged, disrespectful, and annoying.
author: Jessie A.

description: Went there for lunch and the sandwiches were amazing. I got the tuna and it was huge and delicious!  The salad that came with it was wonderful and great.  The dressing was so darn good too.  The atmosphere was friendly and upbeat.  Would highly recommend this.  We also sat outside as the weather was lovely.   They need more outside tables though.
author: Jane K.

description:
This cafe is great.
Located in the inner Richmond neighborhood, it is right on the corner near golden gate park.
There seems to be a lot of regulars that visit the cafe. I can clearly see why after eating here. It was fantastic. 
I had a breakfast burrito. I would highly recommend it. The flavor was awesome and they gave a generous portion. 
I had a regular coffee and it was great. I am for sure coming back for breakfast.
There are a few beers on tap here which is awesome.
There is a decent selection of food here as well. Everything looks amazing and is priced fantastic!
There's inside and outside seating with parking that available right in front. 
This is definitely a fun place that you should check out.
author: Kevin S.

description: I've been coming here a long time. Great place to stop during a bike ride. Bike parking outside or seating outside (if you don't have a bike lock). Can get very busy. Great selection of beer and wines.
author: Christine L.

description: Great food service and tea. Located right next to Golden Gate Park. I really enjoyed the atmosphere and food and tea.
author: Jesse S.

description: A friend suggested to meet at this cafe, so while we waited for her to join us we went ahead and ordered a sandwich (The Indurian) and the veggie wrap. Both items were absolutely tasty. The nitro cold brew was delicious, too. Service didn't disappoint either. Definitely give it a try if you're in the area.
author: Rica M.

description: Wonderful neighborhood cafe! The name means red bicycle, and the theme is cycling. But is not over the top in bike neediness, like the coffee shops where a bunch of Lycra-clad guys gather to talk loudly. Browsed through a book of vintage Tour de France. Good coffee but could use a little more variety in the baked goods. I'll have to come back for lunch.  Breakfast and dinner is all they serve.
author: Roopinder T.

description: This is hands down my favorite little place in the area. They seem to have whatever i'm in the mood for. The breakfast burrito, the veggie sandwich and the cheese sandwich kicks butt so far. Also, the people that run it seem to be super cool and the vibe when you walk in seems very down to earth. I don't eat meat, but all their non meat options have been a hit for me thus far.
author: Marcus E.

description: Great first visit. I ordered the breakfast burrito. It arrived hot and well prepared. You could tell they use quality ingredients. It was served with a tasty portion of pico salsa and crunchy tortilla chips. I definitely look forward to returning.
author: Lee D.

description: Foods good if you want to be treated rudely by the manager and his staff. So disappointed with poor local service.
author: Kendra W.

description: The food is very good, the restaurant is nice but the service is awful. The waiter didn't know the dishes and he wasn't friendly at all.
author: Olivier M.

description: The most stunningly beautiful sandwich I have ever been served. A great friendly staff, eclectic decor, and best of all the sandwich was nearly as delicious as it was enticing. Wow!!! Also not too pricey. Love this place.
author: Michael M.

description:
Love love love this place. 

Everything is super nicely done. I got the McAllister scramble and my hubby got the breakfast burrito. Fresh ingredients and good flavors. Kept us both full for a while and we were lucky enough to grab a table in the sun outside.

Wasn't too busy when we went around 9:30 on a Saturday. I also got a chai latte, which was good but just a bit too sweet for my taste. I'll try another drink the next time we stop by.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
I gotta say, I was pleasantly surprised by this place. Not too much was open for brunch on a Saturday at 3:30pm but after calling multiple places we found on Yelp, Velo Rouge gave us good news...brunch served all day! 

I decided to go with the breakfast sandwich and after deciding to get it on an english muffin (you can choose between english muffin, bagel, or croissant), I asked the guy ringing me up what he liked best as the sandwich option and he said croissant, so croissant it was. And man was he right. That sandwich was pretty fantastic, I only wished it had been a little bit bigger :)

Side note, the water here is weirdly delicious - it's ice cold with cucumber and lemon (i think?) mixed in. Talk about refreshing!
author: Ilana B.

description:
I've gone a few times since its walking distance from school. It is a typical cafe located in an SF neighborhood, cute and simple.

Although the Mt. Ventoux Breakfast Sandwich wasn't that big, it still tasted pretty decent. It is made up of: an egg sandwich on a croissant or bagel, with oozing cheese, bacon, and avocado. It's a great choice for something you need on the go or a quick bite. As for the cappuccino, it was a tad bland. But sometimes you just gotta do it for the aesthetics right? 

Unfortunately, I just dislike how small the place. It can be quite difficult to find a place to sit or to come in big groups.
author: Breanna N.

description:
My bf lives right by this cafe so I've been here a few times. The last time I went, I ordered an open-faced sandwich. This is an SF concept that, I assume, provides the consumer with more substance than an actual sandwich because the contents of an actual sandwich are restricted to the insides of the bread. It defeats the purpose for me because the bread ends up getting soggy under the middle part. But I digress.

For my order, I requested that they "close" the sandwich because I didn't want the bread to get soggy. The cashier said she couldn't do this, and offered another sandwich with mostly meat ingredients (I'm veggie) that was "closed." My bf and I had a good laugh at this whole exchange. However, I took the risk and ordered the open-faced sando without mushrooms and bacon.

Anyway, I got the sando and it came with mushrooms, the bane of my vegetarian existence (seriously, I don't get how anyone can like them). The bread, like I predicted, was soggy.  I guess custom orders aren't their specialty here.
author: Chelsea R.

description:
My boyfriend found this place while looking for a cafe close by that serves brunch a few months ago. We've been several times since & have enjoyed a nice breakfast before taking the dog for a walk in the presidio. 

You order at the counter then find an open table. Space is on the smaller side but turnover is pretty quick and we've never had an issue not finding a table (there is seating outside too). We usually split the Arguello breakfast with avocado and it's consistently good. Space has a bike theme to it which brings in the cyclist crowd, but I've also seen families, friends and people just hanging out. Its not on a major street, but there is neighborhood parking only so may take a few min to find a spot.
author: Anastasia S.

description: Honestly I mostly walked in here because I had to charge my phone, but I ordered the veggie wrap and it was one of the yummiest vegetarian sandwiches I've had in forever!!! This place was super cute and swanky and seems like an awesome place to do work/ grab lunch with a friend. Will definitely be back!
author: Davita P.

description: Had a great time studying at Velo Rouge this early afternoon. The latte was nice and strong with delicious foam. The Pantani sandwich was delicious and came with a side salad. I spent quite a while studying and no one bothered me, which I really appreciate.
author: Veronica L.

description:
Super friendly and efficient little cafe. Reminded me of the little cafes in West Village I came to love. Super fast service, generous portions and fresh ingredients. The McAllister breakfast/sandwich??? came with perfectly cooked potatoes (crispy outside, soft inside), sauteed onions and mushrooms that were melt in your mouth yummy without being mush. The spinach was sauteed just enough to be spinach al dente, which I find challenging in my own kitchen. Fresh feta and not-to-crunchy, not-chewy bacon made the perfect compliment to the eggs atop muffin. The ingredients blended wonderfully and all kept their individual flavors. The portion size for price was much more than I've experienced in the area.
And I'm not sure what espresso beans they use but the latte was perfect, in my own togo cup. 
Plenty of outside seating for a cafe this size and did I mention the cute little doggy friendly water bowl and impromptu tying post outside. 
Today I'm only a tourist but this would be my go to recommendation for breakfast to my friends visiting Inner/Outer Richmond, San Francisco or anywhere close.
author: Zachary G.

description:
I got a coffee and  an alfajor!! Coffee was meah!!!
Alfajor was an insult. I was wrapped in plastic really?? When I open the plastic it was a  disaster  the alfajor was crumbs all over. It tasted like 3 days old.  Flavor was nasty.
author: Cecilia C.

description: Came in from out of town and stopped here for breakfast. Delicious food, great portions, great service, and good environment. All the ingredients seem very fresh. Good job!
author: Nathan A.

description:
Velo Rouge Cafe is in a corner location. prime right? yes and no. not much seating so peak hours will be standing room only.

menu: breakfast, lunch, sammies, specials, expresso, happy hour

eats: great hornet veggie (9;.95)
-"cucumber,, tomato, red onions, mushrooms, avocado, sprouts, beets, greens, hummus, swiss, chedder, jack cheese on 9 grain bread.
*not superfab, taste comes from hummus, cheeses, bread fab, just right, better than average, fulfilling.
side salad:mixed greens, cucumbers, tomatos, carrots, white cheese? tasty!

brew: stumptown (m.3)
-fab smooth sipping, not bold, not watery, a fav.-

take outs:
-cashier pointed out Leipheime  Breakfast burrito (7.95) another good vegan choice. eggs, etc, .
-HH (didn't note hours): pints (4)
'-people in this area fortunate to have Velo Rouge. i'm envious. :)
-fab, smiling, neighborhood service.....
author: Victor G.

description: Horrible service! They canceled my wife's order somehow during their change of cashiers and said it was our fault, although I paid for it. The manager was VERY RUDE about it as well! I still can't believe they blamed us about the order being canceled even though we paid. Why couldn't he just say, "We screwed up when we changed the cashiers and here is your sandwich no charge." One and done!
author: Lee C.

description:
I went to Velo Rouge this morning to get breakfast with a few friends who live near Golden Gate Park. We were taking out food over to the Conservatory is we could sit outside and eat as we were with my dog. The service was great. The line was long but the people working the register kept it moving. I ordered two of the Mt. Ventoux breakfast sandwiches, one with avocado, which was a nice option. After ordering breakfast I realized that I didn't have a bowl for my dog (he lost his travel bowl on the beach the previous day) and I asked for a small cup to bring along. The girl behind the counter flat out refused and said that if I wanted water I could order a bottle. I was a paying customer and I explained that it was for my dog and that I already had a water bottle and she still refused. I was a little off put because I was a paying customer and I was asking for a cup - not an actual drink. 

The food was great, but the experience was off putting. I have traveled to many cities and eaten in many places and I have never been refused a disposable cup. If not for this fact this could have been a 5 star review!
author: Nicole C.

description:
I came here on a weekend wanting some breakfast food. Luckily this place serves breakfast food until 4:30 PM. There weren't a lot of people in the restaurant, which was super nice. I ordered the Arguello Breakfast which is 2 eggs scrambled (but you can choose how you want your eggs), country style potatoes, and 2 slices of bread (wheat or sourdough). It was very good. 
I noticed that this is the perfect place to grab coffee and catch up with your friends or bring your laptop and work to do. 
I will be back!
author: Kelly O.

description: Best tuna melt I've had, EVER. Mixed with mustard, finely chopped pickles, and onion to deliver crunch flavor. Perfectly toasted bread, yummy fresh tomato, and even without the cheese (I'm recently lactose intolerant, but have fond cheese and melt memories), the sandwich is a winner. Great lunch or breakfast spot near the park.
author: Carla M.

description:
This is purely about the PB&J. With all the media coverage recently about PB&J in the NBA, I got the craving. 
Too much jam, too little PB, standard shelf ingredients, overpriced at $6. The bread was toasted and on point though.
author: Kevin M.

description: Updating my review - still love this place - breakfast yesterday was delicious - am hoping I can convince them to bring back the FANTASTIC, FUN & HILARIOUS... AND FREE ... Friday evening comedy shows!!!  They were so much fun - such a great way to start a Friday night - glass of wine, snack and laughs ... we arrive for the show last Friday after returning from our summer holidays & were so very disappointed to discover that it had been cancelled due to one aggressive complaint from one customer (who must be completely humorless).  Velo rouge is a real community spot - so much so that they want everyone to feel welcome - apparently even if a person is determined to be unhappy & ruin everyone else's experience.  The comedy show was a generous treat to the neighborhood & I'm very grateful for it!!  Please bring it back & don't let the complaints of one humorless sad sack ruin it for everyone else!!!  Seriously don't let anger win!!
author: Waverunner J.

description:
Friends and I were walking around GG Park on Saturday afternoon, and we were starving. After getting lost among the trails, we found our way to Arguello. What caught our eye were the red awning and Chimay sign. As soon as you walk in, it's the ultimate SF vibe with a funky couch made of bike seats, and lots of families and couples. 

I ordered a veggie sandwich and Fort Point IPA. Veggie sandwich ($11) was underwhelming and soggy. I think it must have been microwaved. I enjoyed the Fort Point ($4), especially after walking what seemed like eternity. It tasted fresh and light. 

You might have to wait around for seats, and it's a bit crowded. The staff was very nice and friendly. They quickly took away plates and cups when you're done.
author: Thomas L.

description: The portions were kind of small and it took forever to come out. The servers didn't seem too friendly. But I guess it's all natural or whatever...
author: Brady J.

description: It's ok. I live very near by and would love to love this place, but the food is just ok, the drinks are ok, and the staff varies from awesome to rude. If you are looking for brunch, there are other places nearby that I've had a better experience with. Again I want to love Velo, it's literally a 2 minute walk from my door, it's just... meh.
author: Dave L.

description:
Really pricey for what you receive. Coffee is $2.50 for a small cup and no refills. I swapped out potatoes for salad with my breakfast - they charged $5 for this. 

The food was ok - but my bacon wasn't edible bc it was so undercooked 

A $18 breakfast is pretty steep even for SF. Take those dollars and go across the park to Zazie.
author: Anne H.

description: Great coffee and sandwiches. I love the bicycle theme. I'm excited to try more items on the menu.
author: Bryan H.

description:
Definitely a fan of Velo. It's a great neighborhood spot and has a great breakfast special (huevos rancheros). Their coffee is always consistent and good. I'm a fan. 

They just started taco nights on the weekends, so be on the lookout for that too!

Pro tip: This place is *always* crowded. Be prepared to have to share tables and wait in a weekend line that can run out the door -- it's well worth it for an order at the counter breakfast bite and cup of coffee!
author: Erin R.

description: Had an egg sandwich with their house potatoes and a mocha. The egg sandwich could have used salt, but the potatoes were sooooooo good they made up for it.
author: Amber B.

description: Oh my goodness another gem found off the beaten path. Friendly service,  flavorful food and no putting on airs just a cyclist friendly attitude.
author: Francine E.

description: Lox and bagel was amazing. Service was great and they let me work from there. Really loved my experience.
author: Sam B.

description: A very nice neighborhood cafe with satisfying comfort food. Super fast service, generous portions and fresh ingredients.
author: Colten F.

description:
Nice vibe. Late afternoon coffee break. Easy to find parking today. Quiet neighborhood cafe. Good oatmeal cookie . = )
Got a little Stumptown coffee perk me up before the drive back home in Monday traffic. 
They also serve breakfast and lunch. I will need to come back. Everything sound delicious. Till next time!
author: Irene K.

description: Great sandwiches, quick service, perfect location for grabbing lunch before heading into Golden Gate Park.
author: Yvette T.

description:
Excellent cup of coffee 

Great atmosphere

Came in here to take the edge off and was definitely not let down.

Reasonably priced
author: Evan W.

description: Cook sandwich $10 gives the feel of a turkey thanksgiving meal with cranberry jam. Small side sandwich. Outdoor seating . The food was decent the price was fair. Small corner shop.
author: Susan L.

description:
Coffee-obsessed and always working, I'm no stranger to the coffee shops in the Richmond district. That said, Velo Rouge Cafe is definitely in my Top 3 Richmond Cafes. 

:: Coffee ::  4/5. Stumptown coffee is my FAVE. But they charge $$$ bank for it. 

:: Food :: 4.5/5. Yummy, filling sandwiches. Top-notch breakfast burritos. The absolute best soups, ever. Quick tip: you can order a half sandwich with the soup. perfection. you're welcome. :)

::  WIFI :: 3/5. the one thing that's just OK here. it can be shotty at times. 

:: Unexpected Cafe Things :: 10/5. Beer on Tap, Wine, Happy Hour Pizza, Music Events, Game Boards, Live Stream of big games (maybe that was just during the World Series? awesome nonetheless)... + more I have yet to check out.
author: Mel B.

description: Stop burning your coffee, taste like garbage! Use a temp gauge.  Worse coffee in the neighborhood!
author: Demanding T.

description: Great place to stop in for coffee, a beer, or a bite to eat.  There is usually a line in the morning for coffee, but afternoons are usually quiet and offers a wonderful vantage point of the busy Arguello gate traffic.  The coffee is always good, and the staff friendly!
author: Glenn D.

description: Great food and coffee, in a cute location and good neighborhood, the only reason it's getting 3 stars is because of the poor customer service. The blonde girl helping up front was so rude and unwelcoming in the way she spoke to my friend and I, to the point where we decided to just take our food and leave instead of enjoying the cafe.
author: Devyn E.

description: This place was nice and quaint. The food was good and the atmosphere was inviting. However, the service was not the greatest. Associates were more concerned about having fun with one another than getting orders correct. It's important to focus on customer service if you care about customer retention.
author: Israel N.

description: As an old time cafe officiando, I am amazed the a cup of coffee costs $3.00, a cappuccino is 3.50 on the menu. I asked for a very dry and foamy cappuccino, the order was repeated three times between the barrista and cashier. I was charged $4 plus change.  What I got was a sloppy wet latte in cappuccino cup. If I had aid $3.00 or 3.50, I would not have cared as much, but if I am paying $4.+ I expect a little more. So I asked for my $ back and wish I hadn't left the 50 cent tip.
author: Billy C.

description:
The Velo Rouge Cafe manages to be three great things in one very tiny, but charmingly so, package: neighborhood bar, coffee spot, and brunch locale.

At nights, Velo Rouge is home to a few neighborhood personalities, nice bottle selection, heavy wine pours, and a few great beers on tap.  In the morning, they're making exceptional Stumptown coffee drinks priced appropriately, and all day serving up great food.  The Breakfast Burrito is (or at least used to be) the star of the show: this thing is THICK and delicious.  The Arguello Breakfast is a great value with potatoes, eggs, toast, and bacon; and all the lunch sandwiches taste great.

Granted, the place gets pretty crowded, but doesn't that just mean its good?  Don't go expecting to work on your laptop all day, instead, go expecting a great experience with the friendly and skilled staff, and maybe make a few friend you didn't know you had just around the corner.
author: Thomas J.

description:
I came here with my friend on a rainy day for lunch and to catch up. I ordered the Tuna Melt, comes with a side salad, while my friend ordered one of the breakfast options. This cafe is pretty small and seating is limited but there are a few tables outside. 

We paid before we sat down and then they brought our food out. I liked paying before-hand because we didn't have to pay tips. Our food was pretty good; my Tuna Melt was slightly more sour than I would like but probably due to the sourdough bread.
author: Meiling W.

description:
This place is awesome.

Coffee: They serve Blue Bottle and coffee gets served quickly. There's a hearty menu to choose from. I don't feel like it's the best coffee I've ever had or anything. Oddly enough, my hot drinks never stay hot. But solid coffee nonetheless.

Food: I've had mostly their breakfast stuff. It's a little pricier for breakfast when you think of cafe, but this place is a hybrid of cafe and restaurant. The food is good but I would rather come here for coffee than food. Go for the savory over the sweet. There's cafe pastries too.

Ambiance: Kinda divey, super chill. I love it. They even provide books and board games. There's a lot of funky furniture and it's a little dimly lit. Nice place to read a book, hang out, or catch up with someone.

Service: Superb. While my take on the coffee and food were a little above average, the combination of the ambiance and the great service is honestly what keeps me coming back. The baristas and cashiers are always nice. Even the cooks are nice. They're all just cool, sometimes they make small talk but it's never awkward. They're always nice and will be more than glad to help you order. It's what really bumps up my rating an extra .5 stars.

Bonus: The place pushes eco-friendly behaviors. Always a plus. And they're open late. Another big plus.
author: Jacquelyn T.

description:
Huge Disappointment! In search of a place near my house to get a good breakfast burrito I decided to check this place out. 
It is totally beyond me why anyone likes this breakfast burrito. The filling in it had no flavor at all except for spicy. Funny that they don't mention on the menu that it has Sriracha sauce in the eggs, which I learned when I asked the clerk why the filling that is supposed to be eggs was brown. Almost no sign of the alleged "home fries" that are supposed to be in there either. Just a few beans and a little bit of salsa. The whole thing pretty much tasted like cardboard.
How do you really get a breakfast burrito so wrong?
I am pretty sure Levi would be offended that they put his name on this.
Never going back.
author: Dylan L.

description:
This is my neighborhood place where I go for quick breakfast or a sandwich to bring on a hike. 

My favorite breakfast option: McCallister scramble with mushroom, onions, and bacon (without feta cheese). A great mix of flavors to start the day. comfort food.

Favorite take-away sandwich for a hike: roast beef sandwich. It's quite big, so do share it with someone unless you are hiking 5-6 hours straight. It's delicious and the meat is still so flavorful and moist after a couple of hours of drive/hike. Even better with a little bit of wine that one might bring on a hike.

A lot of bikers come through as well as families during the weekend. Avoid the line and get here at 10am on a weekend. The service is not the fastest since they do prepare everything in the back with fresh ingredients for the most part.
author: Rebecca C.

description: Suggested by staff at the Conservatory of Flowers in the Golden Gate Park we walked down and had a wonderful sandwich and latte. Great atmosphere and wonderful service!
author: Quentin R.

description: Super cute cafe right off Golden Gate park. I came here on a Saturday afternoon and found the cafe to be not overwhelmingly packed. Service was great and they make a mean cappucino! I will definitely be back the next time in the area...and try some of the food items off the menu
author: Helen F.

description:
Cute cafe that I want to like more than I do. Yeay for it being a neighborhood place. It feels like it inside. Wish they had a funky, smelly sofa, that would get it another star for authenticity. 

The food is what garners it 3 stars instead of 4. If it tried for basic cafe food, bagels, a few sandwiches, hummus, I'd probably rate it higher but it TRIES to be GOOD food. In the process, it disappoints and sets itself up for feeling overpriced  and underwhelming. Decent breakfast burritos. Good coffee. Neighborhood place worth supporting in a heartbeat.
author: Mario T.

description:
A great cafe for food, occasional music, and for watching major cycling events on TV. Cycling posters. Cycling-themed food named after many pro cyclists. Some outdoor tables where a dog can hang out also. 

Food and coffee are excellent.
author: Bruce J.

description: breakfast food was delicious. their pancakes were very yummy! and their potatoes are great too. friendly customer service. i'll be back to try other items on their menu because it looked so good. it can get busy at times so seating will be limited
author: Carla E.

description: Really bummed about my last experience here. Love the atmosphere and my coffees have always been pretty decent. Unfortunately I got a bagel with cream cheese to go last visit and it consisted of literally less than a teaspoon of cream cheese. Like where is the cream cheese? Kinda sad when breakfast and coffee is kind of a cafes specialty. Didn't think smearing cream cheese on a bagel was that difficult.
author: Kelsey S.

description:
This is my neighborhood cafe. I love the coffee, I love the people, and I love the neighborly atmosphere here.
That said, it would be great if this cafe would install an actual, functioning bathroom lock. It would probably cost less than $100 to buy and install, and would prevent the staff from unlocking the door while people are in there.
Seriously, about 50% of the times I've used the bathroom Manny has unlocked it, looked in, said "oh god I'm sorry" and then left without re-locking it, leaving all parties needlessly emotionally scarred. It happened today. It's happened before. I am seriously terrified of this bathroom.
Vote for Change in 2016- changing the bathroom lock to something more reliable
author: James H.

description:
Sandwiches are huge and delicious. Definitely try 'The Green Hornet Veggie' even if you are not a vegetarian, it's worth it.

The have a bike rack right outside so very friendly place for bicycle riders in the city.
author: S J.

description:
This place has been on my list for a long time but the lines get so long around brunch time on Saturdays. I decided to wake up early on a Saturday (got there at 9am) and although the place was pretty full I was able to order quickly and find a seat. 

The breakfast burrito is the best I've had in the city - DELICIOUS! It's vegetarian (unless you add meat) which is +1 in my book since I'm a veg. It's big, very flavorful, perfect amount & combination of ingredients. Definitely worth a stop! Coffee was great as well.
author: Hailey H.

description: This is my go-to neighborhood place! Coffee is delicious, as well as the extensive food choices. Line is out the door for a reason on the weekends. The staff is also awesome and it's nice to go to a place where people say hello. Definitely check it out if your around Golden Gate Park or biking through the Presidio.
author: Vanessa R.

description:
Stumbled upon this cafe after riding through the park. What a find! Sandwiches were delicious especially the club sandwich. Salad on the side was also fresh and tasty. $3.50 pints at happy hour were a bargain. Look forward to coming again soon! 

My recommendation: the club sandwich! Yum!
author: Kalia J.

description:
Pros: good coffee
Cons: subpar baked goods, no heat, unreliable wifi, indifferent staff

If you just want a decent cappuccino to go, this place will do the trick.

If you also want to hang out for a while with a pastry and use the wifi, forget it.  Especially if it's a cold day.
author: Patrick C.

description:
We're going rouge!

This cafe is dear to my heart. I used to study here during finals week when I was at USF. The cafe is small, quaint, and laid back. The staff are super friendly and they have such amazing food and coffee! Caffeine kick, right away! I took my bro and cousin for a quick bite before my flight. I got the McCallister scramble while the two of them go the breakfast burritos. Man, breakfast food is just so good! The McCallister scramble consists of an open faced scramble (egg, bell pepper, bacon, cheese, spinach, and potatoes) on an English muffin. It was amazing! The seasoning they use is really good, especially on the potatoes. Yum! I got the caffe latte too which is served with blue bottle coffee! 

The cafe is decorated with bicycle theme and it is very cute and really neat how they made some of their furniture from bicycles. Overall, an amazing cafe with such sweet people!
author: Joyce D.

description:
Velo Rouge is a better than average coffee shop, but it's not a destination for food. Rave reviews are likely because they serve and brew good blue bottle, and are a great option for bikers who want food on the go.

I loved the personality and atmosphere, plus the service was super friendly; however, menu items are quite limited, fare is pretty standard tasting, and the space is tiny... too tiny for working on a laptop. Clearly this place caters to those on the go, I can't imagine how crowded it might be on a weekend as it was at capacity at noon on a Thursday.

From a food standpoint, the famed Ventoux croissant sandwich was good but tiny - there was not enough meat to bread ratio and as you know a croissant is already pretty small. The club sandwich was large but standard (like something I make at home), and I would have rather spent my money on something unique for lunch.
author: Jess C.

description: So if you're down to spend $10 and some change on a breakfast burrito, it may be one of the best you've had. Not to be confused with your greasy local taqueria business, this bfast burrito comes across a little more healthy, but still packs a ton of flavor. They grill the tortilla to perfection, scramble fresh eggs, add black beans, a few potatoes, pico, avo and in my case extra crispy bacon. Definitely a fan, but still on the fence about the price.
author: Marissa B.

description: This place was so cute and delicious! I got the breakfast burrito. It was a bit greasy, but the portion made up for it. It was still pretty good! My friend got the scrambled sandwich, and all of it was good. The potatoes were the best part.
author: April K.

description:
Velo Rouge cafe is an easy place for me to review since I venture here quite frequently.   I love the Breakfast Burrito and it's my go-to here.   Who doesn't love a breakfast burrito?!?!?  

It has your cafe fixins with either your side of coffee, beer or wine (depending on the time of day).   A few select spots outside to sit at if it's nice and you will run into people from the neighborhood.   

Occasionally they host local talent on Friday and Saturday evenings.  It's a great spot to grab a bite either pre-park or post-park, or just while you're in the area.  

The lines can be a little long on the weekends or during peak times, but that is typically how EVERY good establishment in SF is.
author: J B.

description:
Stopped in to velo rouge for lunch. It's a very cute little corner cafe that has a vintage bicycle theme going on. There isn't much seating but it wasn't too busy when we got there around 1:30pm. They have a happy hour with drink specials from 2pm: discounted pints and house wines.  We also saw a sign that promoted live music and movies there on certain nights. We definitely plan to head back and check that out at some point. 

They have a great sandwich menu and some good breakfast options. We decided to try something from each menu: the green hornet veggie sandwich and the breakfast burrito. Both were amazing. The sandwich had 3 types of cheese, hummus, beats, sprouts and all the other standard veggies. It was really delicious. 

That breakfast burrito tho... Amazing!  Definitely the best I've had in a long time.  We just got the standard but you can also add meat. I highly recommend ordering it no matter what time of day you stop in. The breakfast menu is served all day so you have no excuse not to try it!
author: Whit C.

description:
I wish I lived near here, so I could come back all the time!
The food, the service, and the prices were all good. Definitely recommended.
author: Andrew T.

description:
I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could. Decent sandwich (I got the coppi) but not good enough for me to really want to come back. The sandwich would have benefitted from more cranberry sause. It ended up just tasting like the jack cheese. The side salad was a bit salty but bonus points for having goat cheese. 

The decor is fun--a bunch of bicycle themed posters and even a funky bike bench, chair, and table. 

Service was good. We liked the people who worked here. 

All in all, meh.
author: Sarah S.

description: This place is yummy, and super busy. Don't forget to bus your table after you're done. They have a compost, recycle and trash sorting mechanism. We give this place two thumbs up!
author: Jacquelyn S.

description: 5 stars for having a picture of a cute pug on the door. Also their food and coffee is top notch.
author: Ricky S.

description:
Very decent sandwiches, good salads, and nice coffee makes this place a pretty good stop on any lazy weekend afternoon.

Bike racks aplenty, Velo Rouge is decked out in vintage bike memorabilia, sandwiches named after cycling greats and some awesome decor, if you like that kinda thing.  I like getting a pint.

Often families in there, but it's roomier than it first appears and the only downside is the sometimes unfriendly staff who never seem to give the happy hour discount unless you ask for it.

That loses you a *. Bastards.
author: Chris H.

description:
Love this place! Fresh and tasty food, nice decor, cool staff, outside seating in the sun, decent prices. What else do you want? 
The only thing i can think off would be a bigger menu; mabye add a cobb salad, Nicoise Salad, Pain-bagnat?

I am a regular there and my favorites items are: Mork's club sandwhich, B.A.LT, Le Tour Salad.
author: Marc G.

description:
I can only speak for the breakfast burrito. I came in and out with breakfast burritos and took them home.
1. My bf breakfast burrito fell apart. They didn't wrap it correctly with the tortilla.
2.They also didn't put enough foil on it because it was leaking through the brown bag.
3. it was SOOO SPICY. I like to put la vics sauce on it (La Vics from San jose) but it was already so spicy on it's own that I couldn't add to it.

What is good at the breakfast burritos is that they come with real avocados. That is a plus...but I still wouldn't buy them here again.
author: Julianna I.

description:
I went to Velo Rouge Cafe yesterday to meet up with a friend and catch up. 

VRC is one block from Golden Gate Park on Arguello, so it is ideally situated if you want to meet people before going into the park or to meet up before going on a bike ride up the street to the Presidio and beyond.  

We bellied up to the counter and perused the tea selection which was all from one brand of teas. Their only exception was one I-R-I-S-H tea. That's rare. I've never seen an Irish tea.

The counter person pointed out that they also sold Irish goodies like candy or other snack at the counter. Okay, personal note to return to try Irish snacks...  C ended up trying the Irish tea (a black tea) which he liked. I got an Oolong tea with the cutest name - something like 'Yellow Monkey in a Mellow Mood' - not exactly that phrase really but you get the drift.  

We sat and chilled. We caught up. The place was busy but not so busy that the noise level prevented us from talking comfortably. Awesome time at VRC. I'd go back in a heartbeat to enjoy the lovely bike-oriented, woodsy ambiance and a cup of tea. It fits so well in this foggy, cool part of the Ctiy.
author: Joanna T.

description:
The food here is decent. Nothing too special but they have a pretty good breakfast menu and some good sandwiches. However, as with most places in the city, the coffee is overpriced and they are really stingy with it. 

I got an ice coffee for almost 3 bucks. It came in a really small glass that was filled with ice. When I asked if they do refills they said that they do "but its the same price as the coffee".... So I basically paid 3 dollars for 4 ouces of coffee. Good one Velo Rouge, way to be cheap to your costumers...

Unfortunately, they can get away with that kind of crap because there are not many other options in the area.
author: Guy D.

description: Yikes. This place is frat boy central. Which does not lend itself to a nice environment. Also, they totally fucked up our order. I ordered the two eggs breakfast and they brought out two eggs without the breakfast. And when I complained they did not take responsibility and made us pay them additional cash because he claimed he charged us too little (and since he never gave me a receipt I couldn't argue) and wait another 20 minutes for our meal. They should have fixed the mistake immediately and not charged us maybe even refunded us for all this hassle. Will not be going to this place again. What a horrible experience .
author: Anastasia J.

description: Great chai. Nice little cozy coffee shop. Decent wifi. Good ambiance. Nice friendly staff.
author: Jayh A.

description: The staff were uncourteous and rude. The poor customer service does complete injustice to the food served there. If you don't mind possibly experiencing a disgruntled & unfriendly waiter or if food (sans service) is the only thing that matters to you, go ahead!
author: Divya B.

description:
This place's clean and the sandwiches (Coppi) were delicious. So the Food Safety Alert is inaccurate.

The servers are courteous and I love the vibes.  I'll be back.
author: Wing W.

description: Not much personality behind the counter, but the food was great, creative. I very much enjoyed the dill on the breakfast potatoes, decent iced latte (no flavor options thou) Overall I liked it!
author: Thurston T.

description:
After a 60 hr Lyft week. This was the closest place to me.

I walked in and ordered and felt like a deer in headlights when (Alison?) I believe her name was asked me what I wanted to drink with her big doe eyes. My heart wasn't prepared for that flutter.

The dirty chai I ordered was great it had a heart on top which I know was special just for me! Just kidding but little details like that subconsciously make me happy after a long week.

Now if I knew that the breakfast burrito comes with the worlds smallest side of salsa I would have asked for 2 or 3. Maybe I just eat way too much salsa.

I would return. I just wish I was alert enough to realize it comes meat free. Bacon is a must next time.
author: Samuel W.

description: I love this place. The staff and food are awesome. A great neighborhood cafe in a great location
author: Ciaran M.

description: Awesome breakfast and fast service after sf half marathon. Thanks to the staff for making the best breakfast ever.
author: Arik H.

description: Cashier wasn't very friendly. The $5 minimum for credit card sucks, and my coffee was $4.75. He wouldn't let it slide and wanted me to buy an extra thing to fulfill the minimum... maybe I'm expecting too much, but I've never experienced this at other cafes before...he also didn't get my order exactly correct (I said yes to whipped cream for the mocha and there was no whipped cream added).
author: Kat H.

description: This place is very convenient for cyclers in particular.  the french toast was amazing.  They also speak multiple languages; however, they tend to get busy during the weekend.
author: Moaid M.

description:
If you have not tried their breakfast burrito, you're missing out on life. 

Yes, it's vegetarian. BUT carnivores (like myself) will enjoy it, nonetheless. Add bacon--it just makes an amazing burrito even better.

Wish they'd give more salsa with their (noticeably stale) chips, but the main course makes up for it.
author: Steffie H.

description: This is a place I love coming back to when I am in the city. Cozy, friendly baristas, free internet and Blue Bottle. The perfect little coffee spot.
author: Eve V.

description:
I came here yesterday and got the breakfast sandwich and there was nothing wrong with it or the service.

Today, however, the service has left me feeling unwelcome and like I'm a burden to the woman that works here. I ordered the breakfast burrito (nothing amazing) and went to sit on one of the tables outside as there were none available inside. After I got my food, a man came outside and said 'did you order a coffee?' I said yes, as I had. And he then said 'great, it's inside'. I was expecting him to then bring it out to me, as the only other option would be to leave my food unattended on the street and come in and get it myself. After about 15 minutes the waitress brought my (now cold) coffee out to me, slammed it down on the table and was overall just kind of passive aggressive about it. Are waitresses not expected to bring people their coffee in San Francisco or what? The chef who brought my food out to me (does he do all the work at this place?) however, was very friendly and smiley.
author: Veronica B.

description: Fuck this place I was treated like 3rd class citizen everyone order was correct people kept getting served and I was getting skipped. They keep looking at me they know I'm waiting for something and when I approach them they treat me with hostility no way to treat a paying customer instead of pushing my order to the front since it was there mistake they make me wait all the time way back of the line to order my sandwich so took more than an hour. Never coming back. No reason to wait for more than an hour for two measly sandwiches
author: David V.

description:
So everyone knows brunch waits get ridiculous in this city. This place is a little different in that it's counter service, so you don't have to wait for a table... but you do have to wait a while for your food. There aren't a lot of tables inside, but you can grab your food to go and take it to the park. 

We ordered the breakfast burrito with chicken apple sausage (and black beans, potatoes, eggs, avocado, and sour cream) served with chips and salsa. The burrito was large, definitely filling, and pretty delicious. That being said, I thought having to add $2.50 for meat was a bit of a high price for an add on. We split the Jack Johnson banana pancakes which had chunks of banana and almond cooked in. They were good, but could have been a little more banana-y. 

Overall the food was pretty good, and reasonably priced (for SF). We probably waited around a half hour for it, so I'm not sure it cut down significantly on the brunch wait. If I came back on a weekend, I'd probably call in a to-go order ahead of time.
author: Jon S.

description:
Cute airy coffee shop, with a bicycle theme (and actually frequented by a couple bicyclists while I was there enjoying my coffee and reading my NYTimes). Seating could get a bit sparse, but the turnover was good enough on a Sunday afternoon that I was able to snag a seat.

Not that many people doing the laptop camping that plagues many a coffee shop. No complaints about my black drip coffee. All in all, a pleasant place to grab a cup of coffee, enjoy it while people watching and reading the paper, and then moving on with your day.
author: Michael C.

description:
Spring Mix Green Salad exceeded my expectations, the dressing was light and went really well with the pepper flavor in the mixed greens.
The place was pretty crowded on Saturday morning but the service is swift and the wait for a table wasn't too long.
author: Kimi K.

description:
**** COFFEE *****

**** HUEVOS RANCHEROS ****

This is how I would sum up the (many) times I've had brunch at Velo Rouge. It's one of my favorite brunch and breakfast spot in San Francisco. Here's why:

- I just love the vibe. I can't get enough of it. The inside is super super cute, it had wooden furniture, a bunch of cute blackboards up on the walls, and the outdoor sitting, though really small, is perfectly sun-oriented - provided the sun is out.

- Their food is heaven. Literally. You just have to try their Huevos Rancheros, they're the best I've ever had I'm not gonna lie. Plus their coffee is pretty solid, only downside being it's not refillable... 

- I would say the prices are quite decent, and the service is good. 

I'll see you soon Velo Rouge!!!
author: Sev G.

description:
Friendly staff, the inside is pretty small but not the most inviting atmosphere to hang out in.

Basic cafe menu.
author: Spoon G.

description:
I came here on a Monday for lunch, and the food was pretty good. We had the Coppi sandwich, which has turkey, spinach, cheese, and cranberry jam and the Ullrich tuna melt, which has tuna, cheese, and mustard. Both sandwiches come with a side salad. I tasted both of the sandwiches and they were both tasty, but there was nothing particularly amazing about either one of them. 

The cafe is cute but really small, granted we came at what I am guessing is their peak time right around noon and all the seats were taken. We almost had to take our food to go, but last minute someone left and we got a seat. I will say the staff is super friendly, one of the ladies behind the counter was keeping an eye out and as soon as she noticed someone leaving she asked if we wanted to stay, and immediately cleaned the table for us. 

I like that it is close to my job, so I will definitely come again to taste the breakfast items.
author: Alejandra I.

description:
Passed by this place multiple times when going to work and there is always lots of people lined  up during lunch time. 

Decided to come here one morning with my friends and we got the club sandwich, the tuna melt, breakfast burrito, and most popular breakfast croissant. 

We all liked what we got, however the breakfast croissant wasn't all that good, as my friend said. It was really small and wasn't all that good. 

All the other food we got was decent portions and it was pretty tasty!
author: Julia K.

description:
Very cool little coffee shop/restaurant close to Golden Gate Park. I live within walking distance of this cafe and know I'll be frequenting it in the months to come! The only downside: seating can be difficult to find because of the size!

They serve their huevos rancheros only on the weekends and the breakfast burrito is delicious (add ham!). Overall a very awesome place to eat and hangout with friends!
author: Nico C.

description: I went to Velo Rouge with a friend and never in my life have I been so appalled by the service provided to customers. When even asking the gentlemen at the cashier what to suggest to order, I received a significant amount of attitude. After requesting my latte to be made extra hot and the barista failing to do so, I was directed to the microwave to heat up my $5 latte instead of them just agreeing to remake it. I will never come back here.
author: Henna S.

description: Super small with uncomfortable seating.  There are literally thousands of places just like this in the city with better atmospheres.
author: Melissa M.

description:
I used live around the block from this place and would come often because, first and foremost, they serve Blue Bottle Coffee!! Although I don't live near anymore, I still wouldn't mind stopping by for a good grilled sandwich.

I would normally stay for brunch and order the Pantani or the The Coppi. They come with a small salad that usually has apple/strawberries, goat cheese and a lemon/olive oil dressing. So refreshing!! 

It's a small cafe so don't be a jerk and just come to use the free wifi.
author: Amelia C.

description: My favorite thing to get here is the Levi Leipheimer Burrito. A total breakfast delite.
author: Scott C.

description:
Great place! Healthy, fun options for breakfast or lunch. Soup is always vegan and options range from sandwiches and omelets to granola and yogurt. Each time I've been there the owner has been racing around, checking on orders, ensuring customer satisfaction, and keeping the vibe light and positive. 

During the day Velo Rouge Cafe serves as a place to meet up with friends, grab a bite, or study, and at night it serves wine and hosts live music. Definitely a versatile and unique place. 

It's near USF so the crowd is pretty young, but it's by no means a purely student population. Stop by for some yummy grub next time you're in the area.
author: Zoey S.

description: A charming little cafe with a good breakfast and lunch menu. Very generous portions and reasonable prices. I had the club sandwich and could only finish half of it. Very high quality ingredients and a nice atmosphere. I recommend it.
author: Chris B.

description:
This place captures the essence of SF local.  Who else would be caught mingling in this crowded, bustling cafe on a Sunday morning?  Unfortunately, it's one of the FEW cafes located right off of Fulton and Arguello (flower conservatory/de Young Museum/Sharon Meadow area of Golden Gate Park).  Fortunately, it IS one of the few located HERE!  I'm so thankful for it because--you see--before Sunday exercise rounds or a day at GGP, some people need their coffee.  Coffee coffee coffee.  I'm not big on coffee but I can tell that they have several choices.  They carry blue bottle coffee, and each cup is freshly brewed after ordering.  Can't ignore that small cabinet of pastries.  From what I saw, coffee is the main commodity here.  

As for the breakfast, I ordered Mt. Vernoux (egg, bacon, cheese inside a croissant) and felt as though maybe I could've made this at home.  Kind of pricey for that shebang.  Took quite some time for the food to come out.  Crowds build fast on a Sunday morning.  There is an optimal-but-not-overwhelming list of quick and easy to eat breakfast items like croissants, lox, breakfast burritos but the Yelp pictures really help me choose.  Hey, chips come with the breakfast burrito!  And the crust is grilled quite like a panini which makes it special.

What sets this place apart from other breakfast joints is being able to eat your breakfast with your hands!  Convenience is a good selling point because then we can take our orders to-go.  Very welcoming and industrious atmosphere (employees sure are working hard and people sure are hungry for breakfast), but space is quite tight.  They also have this cute glass car table.
author: Janet T.

description:
CAFE LATTE PERFECTION!!!!
(4 stars)

As usual, my Sundays are dedicated to explore and cafe hobo-ing around my city. What a great cozy cafe near Golden Gate park and a great way to spend a rainy day in this cafe reading "technical" material with the itouch on blast.

- food, tasty. cofffee/espresso lovers (two words: blue bottle)
- price, affordable
- ambiance, cozy, cute neighborhood cafe
- service, pretty good

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.

*** see pictures ***

ARGUELLO BREAKFAST ($6.50) - 2 eggs any style, country style potatoes, two slices toast. It was a yummy, simple brunch plate for myself. Enjoyed the country style potatoes and the portions were filling, i didn't finish everything.

CAFE LATTE - they use blue bottle coffee. for the san franciscans, they know exactly what that means. the taste of my latte was silky smooth and i loved the little heart they made from the foam. 

They have a variety on the menu: brunch, lunch, wine, beer, pastries, etc. Everyone here is either just hanging out, reading, or on their laptops. Hard to find parking in the neighborhood. Good luck trying to snag a seat (i was fortunate to grab a seat by the window). Also, it would be nice if people take their dirty dishes to the bins before they leave. Also would be nice if the waiters see dirty dishes holding up seats, to take them away.

Will I be back? Yes i will be.

JABA APPROVED. Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description: Walked in here after a long day of walking in the park and immediately liked the atmosphere and had a funny conversation with the guys behind the counter. I saw that they use stumptown coffee and that sold me on this place.
author: Carl L.

description: This is our neighborhood go to spot for breakfast & brunch. Staff s friendly and accommodates all kinds of special requests. Lox bagel is my #1. Levi's burrito without potatoes, but sausage added is #2. All of the breakfast sandwiches rock. Rest of menu looks great as well.
author: Ask N.

description: I wanted to check out a new cafe in the city so stopped by here today. Their coffee is decent but food is overpriced for what you get. Also their wifi is slow -- I can't even stream music online. Cute place for a cup of coffee with a friend. If you're looking for a place to get some work done you might want to look elsewhere.
author: Sarah K.

description:
Nice ambiance. Constantly busy with background noises for people who enjoy reading or studying in that atmosphere. 

besides coffee (they serve blue bottle), they have a few pastries and bfast items.  they have a sign near the register that "if you didnt purchase something there, please dont consume it there."
  
they have cute bicycle related tshirt on sale for $25.  definitely awesome bike concepts.  Bike there for a cup of coffee or some bfast!  near golden gate park so you can continue your bike adventure off to the sunset or haight.
author: Linda T.

description: Great breakfast choices and the ambiance of the place was perfect for us. I have had a sliced avocado on a toasted bagel for breakfast before, but I am sure going to do it now!
author: Jennifer W.

description: presented with a $15  credit card charge slip so I could sign it, I said ok I'll need this peanut bar added to the order. "we have to ring it separately and there is a$.50 surcharge under $5. so, is that ok?" I said"no". when I demanded a refund because it sucks here, "but you haven't tried the sandwich" was the response. I got the refund when I clarified that customer service sucks here.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Good espresso. Decent sandwiches. A bit overpriced and there is an extra charge for credit/debit. Clerks could also be a bit friendlier.

Update: Unfortunately, I'm here to update my review and lower it to 2 stars, which I feel is actually generous. I recently got one of their vegetarian sandwiches and I have to say, it was terrible. 

It may not be easy to make a great sandwich. But It's also probably not easy to make a sandwich this bad. And it certainly wasn't worth 10 bucks. To start, the bread tasted dry and stale.

The sandwich was meant to have hummus on it. However, there was no hummus. The big problem what that is that there are no other condiments in the sandwich. So, when you forget to add the hummus, or just don't care enough to put it in, the sandwich is basically a dry, unenjoyable mess that falls apart, since there's nothing to moisten it or hold it together.

Next, the cheese. I didn't need cheese on a vegetable sandwich. But it came with it. So, what the heck, why not. The problem, however, is that there was literally a HALF INCH of cheese in this thing. To put that in perspective, that easily a 1/4 inch too much cheese to put in a grilled cheese sandwich. It's WAY too much cheese. The sandwich, which was fairly large, was basically 1/4 cheese. Imagine eating a 1/4 inch of cheddar cheese between two pieces of stale bread.

So, here I am trying to get the healthier sandwich option on the menu. But what I get is a really dry, stale sandwich with no condiments or hummus whatsoever, and which is filled with a seemingly random handful of dry vegetables. But on top of that, it has a whole brick of cheese in the middle! It was so bad. 

I should have returned the food and complained. But I honestly just wanted to forget about it as soon as possible. So, I just ate the side salad that it came with and sadly put the rest of the sandwich in the compost.

I feel like these people owe me a meal.
author: Grey Z.

description:
Cute place and good coffee, but not as friendly as you'd expect of a little neighborhood cafe with many regulars. We used to go in quite a bit for coffee or hot chocolate and pastries.

We stopped coming when their health score dropped to 66. I was glad to see they brought it back up to 98, so we decided to stop in today.

We had full breakfast for the first time and portions are good for the price. That said, I didn't finish even half of my breakfast burrito, not because I was full, but because it lacked flavor (it was a bit spicy, but no flavor). It felt like a waste of calories. The banana pancakes were similarly bland and they don't serve real maple syrup.

We'll continue to pop in for coffee at VR, but Cinderella will remain our go-to place for breakfast on this side of Geary. They're very friendly, they know what we usually order, Ritual coffee is served, and everything there is delicious. It's what we love in a small neighborhood cafe!
author: Debra H.

description: breakfast is good (juevos rancheros on the weekend). Lunch and dinner options are pretty average. But overall, a Nice little spot off GG Park with a couple beers on tap and outdoor seating. Coffee isnt great (Blue Bottle - which  tastes like burnt toast to me but some love it) and its a bit pricey $3+ for a small cup.
author: Rex L.

description: Fun spot, close to Golden Gate Park. We walked there after a tour of he Japanese Tea Garden. Love the decor - funky, vintage. Really good coffee! Within walking distance from several bus stops. Definitely worth a visit!
author: Abby T.

description: Solid meals and bites...blue bottle coffee w/ pleasant service. A few outdoor seats and window seating w/ full visible view if you have your pup parked near there supplier doggy bowl
author: Danielle S.

description:
Lovely neighborhood spot - great food and even better service. Like a piece of Brooklyn in the inner Richmond, come here for some excellent breakfast options like their banana pancakes and huevos rancheros.

And the potatoes. Get the potatoes.
author: Shawn H.

description:
I am a grab and go customer at Velo Rouge. That doesn't mean that I like it any less than anyone who has the full sit down experience. 

I am enamored with their iced coffee and make a special point of walking every morning to retrieve it before my plunge into the depths of the library.  Without it I am rediculously less productive and tend to pout in the afternoon. 

The guys who work here are awesome; a super friendly bunch that put me in a good mood at the start of my day.

Thank you!
author: Ali B.

description: Love it here! Great beer, good for after a long bike ride :) food is also delicious, try out the indurain.
author: Brian C.

description:
Small, intimate, and great scrambles.

Best cafe au lait i've had in the US so far. Excellent place
author: Dave M.

description:
I love this place! Blue bottle coffee and the best BLT with Avocado I've had-the sandwich is amazing and it comes with a side salad with sweet corn and strawberries on top. 

Downside-it gets really crowded and there's not a lot of seating inside and it can be hot and stuffy. There are a few seats outside the sidewalk, but on a hot day I wish there were a few more tables in the shade.
author: Julia H.

description:
Great little cafe in the Inner Richmond with excellent food. Nice atmosphere, although sometimes it can get too busy to bear. I often wish they had two lines- one for picking up a to-go order, and one for ordering in- because I frequently find myself waiting in line for 20 minutes to pick up food that I called in (precisely so that I wouldn't have to wait in line). 
That being said, the breakfast burrito has saved me on more than one occasion, and I'm happy to support this neighborhood staple.
author: Louisa B.

description: Great food (the soup was particularly good), Blue Bottle coffee, and pleasant service. I hope to visit again!
author: Vijay N.

description:
The Golden Gate Park Pitstop!

On the prowl for a new breakfast joint within the Richmond district, I stumbled upon Velo Rouge Café. 4-Stars, one $ sign, and close to home -- Yep, I had to check it out. 

Upon entering VRC, at first glance, I thought my directions lead me to a Mike's Bikes or Citizen Chain since the exterior (and interior) was decked out with overwhelming bicycle memorabilia. I'm a foodie, but a bike enthusiasts, so I was ready to flip a 180 and search up a new place to chow down but actually saw that people were eating and being served food. What the hey, why not. 

"Breakfast served All Day"
I like you guys already.

MCALLISTER SCRAMBLE SANDWICH - $6.95 : http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/HjKRwtL3gZ2RL3KQULXKsA?userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ#hPSVGZqGbJAWPjl0HACS0A
This open-faced badboy consisted of 3 scrambled eggs, bacon, grilled onions, mushrooms, spinach, and feta cheese, all toppled over two toasted English muffins with a side of house potatoes. 

THIS WAS SO MUCH FOOD (see picture). The scramble sandwich was PACKED with grilled onions, TONS of mushrooms, a GARDEN of spinach, and smokey BACON everywhere. The muffins were exceptionally nice too, with the tops crispy, and the insides warm and chewy, just like how I like em'. Hands down, one of the best and hearty $7 eats I've had in a LONG time. 

MT. VENTOUX BREAKFAST SANDWICH - $4.95 + $1.25 (AVOCADO) : http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/HjKRwtL3gZ2RL3KQULXKsA?userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ#A7PRkGDRyJ0R78M_R8VKeg
They begin with grilled egg, smokey bacon bites, and jack cheese and melt all that into your choice of a croissant, bagel, or English muffin. It's a small eat, but very portable and packed with your breakfast essentials. Don't forget to add the avocado! 

What makes VRC 5-stars is not because of the bomb breakfast nor how affordable the food can be, but it's the customer service.

I came here today (8/16) and I had to write this review because of their outstanding service! 

Putting all the bicycle photos and wacky bike-inspired furniture and bike references, you have a small coffee shop with a few outdoor seating spots. Intentionally, my girlfriend and I wanted to dine-in since it would be more convenient but all of the tables and chairs were taken, so instead, we just got our order to go. (Why not take a walk into Golden Gate Park and have a little picnic, right?)

The staff acknowledged our request and changed our dine-in order to a to-go. Another one of the staff members rushed outside just to make sure there wasn't any open spaces or tables that needed to be bussed. Nope, still all full. No biggie.

After about 10 minutes, our to-go order came out and was brought to us, along with 2 additional plates and utensils.The staff member asked if we would still like to dine-in since a table actually opened but since we already had everything in to-go containers, we said it wasn't necessary and didn't want to waste their container. He insisted and said it was perfectly fine, with the biggest smile I've seen at 1PM. With a smile like that, we decided to dine in with out to-go order. 

Of course, the food was excellent, but as I was washing it all down with the coffee I ordered, it had a really strong sour pungent taste to it, despite adding my usual dosage of sugar. Maybe it was just me but I asked one of the staff members if it was normal. With any no hesitation whatsoever, he said he would make me a new beverage immediately and noted that VRC's coffee is just like that and quite strong since it's Blue Bottle coffee and individually dripped (I'm a Blue Bottle virgin, I admit it). But within minutes, my new beverage was out and ready to go. 


Very affordable eats.
Fresh ingredients all made-to-order. 
Local Richmond district hidden gem.
Blue Bottle Coffee, if your a fan.
and of course, the Amazing Phenomenal Service.
author: Albert L.

description: This resturant is a nice place to grab breakfast and lunch. Great place to go if your on a budget and want to eat out! It is a good option for bicyclists as they have a bike rack outside with the decor theme inside being pleasing for any bicycle admirer. I would have to agree with others and say that due to the limited seating it is probably best to go on a weekday. They do however have outdoor seating for those sunny days. I ordered the banana pancakes which were huge and fluffy. The three layer stack included almonds in between and yummy bits of banana inside. Thumbs up! I'll be back to try their tuna melt.
author: Aiko C.

description:
Why? = my boyfriend and I were looking for a place to grab breakfast after we returned from buying furniture at 7:30am on Labor Day.  You know how you want a breakfast sandwich or burrito that's quick and decently priced, this is the spot.
People/Vibe = chill/cool, the type of greeting you need on a weekend morning, outdoor seating (a place to put your bike after a long ride!), music - similar to acoustic afternoon (great place to do work for a few hrs)
Food = Great+, Simple, Light
Try = McCallister (no cheese), Mt. Ventoux (no cheese)
author: Lena M.

description:
Food: 
1) Breakfast burrito:  I normally don't like breakfast burritos, but I am a big fan of this one! I don't think there were any potatoes in this one (if there was, I couldn't taste them or see them, which is nice because I don't like potatoes). There were a large variety of other things, like beans, eggs, corn, etc. It meshed together very nicely! It was very delicious against a warm tortilla wrap!
2) Breakfast sandwich: A standard breakfast sandwich here. No complaints. Loved the egg! 

Service:
