Order at the counter, get water/utensils on your own. The folks at the counter were really nice. 

Ambiance: 
Small, cozy little cafe. 2 of the walls were windows, and since this cafe was on the corner, you get a good view of the street. It was raining the day I went, so it was nice to look at the rain outside. It gave a very calming, warm feeling. 

Price: 
Average, decently priced for an American breakfast. 

Overall: 
I liked the dining experience, the food wasn't bad either. I'd totally come again!
author: Amiee H.

description:
Best coffee iv had in USA, breakfast bagel is so good. Friendly staff, cheap prices.

Went there 2 days in a row.

Rating should be higher.
author: Jesse S.

description:
Every Sunday a crazy hyper lawyer gets me outta bed to ride bikes around lake merced and back to the inner richmond via golden gate park.

 Whem we get out of the park we always stop by velo rouge....it has the most amazing coffees (blue bottle...nuff said??): Lattes, mochas, americanos, mochiato blah blah blah....they just brew it right and always make the cutest designs on top.

Hard to get a seat saturday or sunday when it is sunny outside but you can wait for a seat (yeah right). 

Baked goods are delicious as are their salads, oatmeal, sandwiches etc. 

During the week it is not as busy.

 Prices are really wonderful for the product you get.

My only gripe is that the place gets soooo busy and people start getting weird when it gets crowded...none the less it is awesome.
author: David G.

description: i have been meaning to come here for years and now that i have its pretty average to be honest. service wasnt great and its very cramped. i would suggest sitting outside or ordering take away
author: Button L.

description:
Such a cute cafe! 

It's kind of out of the way if you don't live in the area, but if you are, this is a good place to stop for some breakfast or coffee! I got the breakfast burrito and it was so delicious! The black beans were perfect as well as all the other ingredients. I'm usually not a huge fan of breakfast burritos, but this one changed my mind. 

Friendly staff and a good atmosphere.
author: Sze-Wing L.

description:
Only sells coffee in 6oz cups, and no refills. I spent all my time at the register.

At least Star.... will take me to 20oz.
author: Adam G.

description:
I ordered the veggie sandwich looking for a fresh, healthy lunch. The sandwich seemed lik everything I would like, but it was just ok. There was too much going on and the veggies we're cut way to large. It came with hummus, tomatoes, cucumbers, beets, raw mushroom, and raw onions. I like all of those (except or raw mushrooms) but the large chunks of veggies just made it so every bit was just a different raw veggie rather than a sandwich.

The side salad was great, though. Can't say it was worth the trek from nob hill.
author: Maleenee B.

description:
I might be slightly obsessed with this place. I love right around the corner and this is my go to happy hour spot. $3.50 pints, $5 wine (big serving) and happy hour lasts all night! 

The food is really tasty as well. I almost didn't want to write a review because I don't want people finding out about it!
author: Laura M.

description: Yummy breakfasts and coffee. Gets busy and crowded. The female staff is much better and welcoming than the male staff. But if you are not rushed it won't matter. Closeness to GG Park brings all types , especially those who double park to run in and get a coffee - should be shot for messing up traffic in our hood.
author: Why N.

description: Best breakfast burrito in SF. Great staff, delicious ginger cookies!
author: Sarah N.

description:
The coffee is good, but don't go if you are in a hurry.  The staff can be rude and a bit bullish.  Not a fan.  I go here because I live nearby, though I often wish there were another option for good coffee in the 'hood.  

Just today, I was bullied by two of their staff members over slipping off my flip flops while seated.  I gave them some feedback about their approach, politely.  "I get it, but your approach could use some work. I've been coming here for years, everyone has always been nice...until now."

They gave me attitude and cited the health code--suggesting that I should know better and that shoes are required in all restaurants...in a rather paternalistic tone.  I felt like they were trying to run me off.  Maybe they don't like money.

Funny thing is, there isn't a single law in the entire country requiring footwear for patrons.  Certainly, they can put up a sign "No shoes, no service," if they like.  But why bother patrons about shoes when in fact there is no requirement that they do so?  They seemed to be misguided by a mysterious health code.  Simple internet search could solve this problem.  Not sure that I'll go back after this most recent experience.  

If your CC transaction is under $10, they charge a $0.50 fee.
author: Bekki B.

description: My wife and I reenacted one of our first dates which was here. We came for lunch and it was just as we remembered. Very cute cafe with great coffee and food. We the raw veggie sandwich which was good, but I wish I actually chose the one with roasted veggies (next time), the other sandwich was a turkey panini which was off the hook good. The  coffee is strong and made to order. The place seems super bike friendly, Thanks Velo.
author: Drew P.

description:
The food is great! Always comes out nice and hot and The breakfast burrito is to die for! 
The front of the house staff.... Let's just say they could care less about people's morning rush for work. Don't order coffee if you expect it to come out in less than 5 minutes, because you will wait almost 10 for your latte. Also, talking about how hard you plan to party when you get off work while I'm standing in front of you waiting to order isn't professional. I really don't care how drunk you are going to get because you hate your job....
author: Myoko S.

description:
The food is 3 stars. 

But the awesome service and great atmosphere brings it up to a 3.5 star.

Blue bottle coffee too? Hell yeah!!! 4 stars it is!
author: Elaine H.

description:
This place used to make a decent cup of single cup drip coffee. That was what I was expecting when I ordered a $3 cup this morning. What I received was a mediocre cup of non-single cup drip. If this coffee was more in the neighborhood of $1.50, I'd be just fine with it. But you can't brew a pot of mediocre coffee and then try to pass it off as fancy $3 coffee. 
On top of that, when I tried to exchange it for something else, they nearly refused me. So I wasn't too happy with the service either. 
Bottom line: not too happy with this place, don't plan on coming back.
author: Brendan M V.

description:
Neat bicycle decor match its name. The staff are friendly and easygoing. Takes credit cards. 

I like their breakfast scramble and their panini sandwiches. The breakfast burrito is okay but a bit too heavy in the mornings. The food is above average in quality. 

They have great coffee and also serve beer and wine.
author: Alfred L.

description:
I like everything about the place except the fact that I ordered an iced tea - it cost 3 bucks AND came in a tiny glass, maybe 12 ounces at best. Not only do they not offer free refills, they don't even offer discounted refills. 

This practice should be illegal!! Some of us rely on a big dose of it to get our day started...
author: m c.

description:
Unnecessarily overpriced for ordinary food.
Had a coffee and Bagel, and it costed me $8.
Wasn't the best experience.
author: Sun R.

description: I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but it's a great place to grab a bite or coffee, or to catch up with friends or study. The coffee is slightly overpriced but it's pretty tasty and they offer a punch reward card. The food is reasonably priced, always good, and quickly prepared. They have a good variety of sandwiches and dishes - also great for brunch! Every time I go it's usually pretty busy but I've always found a table inside or outside. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is enjoyable. I will continue to go here as long as I live in the neighborhood.
author: Kristin C.

description:
Such a great afternoon cafe! Had a great time catching up with friends! 
Adam, co-owner, treated us great!
Can't wait to make it back!
author: Lindsey H.

description:
How have I not reviewed this place yet?

The people are super friendly and bright eyed and bushy-tailed even early on weekdays when they open and I need a "real" coffee. They serve Blue Bottle which is awesome and have outdoor seating where there seems to always be a motley crew of dogs + people relaxing. 

Great breakfast and you can take out, but beware long lines on weekends to pick up.

Super unique vibe with bicycle-based design everywhere. Seems to be quite the cyclist haven. I'm not adventurous to actually ride a bike in the city, but this is my observation. 

Thursdays nights have good local music...beer and pizza and such after 5...I think that's about it. Awesome place.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Everything I could want from a weekend cafe: great food, great coffee, cozy collegiate atmosphere and a varied hot sauce selection. 

THE FOOD:

Not a massive menu, but it helps them out plates out quickly. The cafe was pretty full when we got there, but still received our food within 10 minutes of sitting down. Really tasty scrambles with well seasoned home fries. 

THE VIBE:

Laid back, full of college students from nearby USF recovering from the night before or studying for the week ahead. Good outdoor seating in a great little neighborhood.
author: Patrick T.

description:
Awesome little cafe next to Golden Gate Park.  Bike themed (super proud of myself for remembering/telling my date that "velo" is French for bicycle while we were there...).  They have a fun atmosphere, friendly staff, and pretty tasty hot chocolates.

It's less than a block from an entrance to Golden Gate Park, so it's a fun place to stop in for a cup of deliciousness before heading out on a walk.  Or, take your drink to go!
author: Brian B.

description: This is the kind of place we all search for, incredible staff and real ambience. The food is incredible! On a 12 mile photo walk on 5-16-2014 we stopped in and were made to feel right at home...bravo!
author: Jon U.

description: Very cozy neighborhood place near USF with solid breakfast/lunch options, quick service and good coffee.  Most entrees are large with healthy portions of protein, bread and fruit/vegetables.  You won't leave hungry and the combinations are really good.  Great brunch meeting spot.
author: Shankar S.

description: Stopped in for a quick bite after a morning visit to the park. Saw other favorable reviews so went for it. The food was Fresh and reasonably priced. Only down side of our visit was the counter staff. Both people we encountered were unfriendly.
author: Lisa M.

description:
i love this place. Great food, great coffee, nice place to chill at. Just do not go on a weekend if you're in a hurry because the line gets long. 

Everything ive eaten there has been deliveious!
author: Beth O.

description: A little small, but a perfect place to relax and warm up with tea and coffee on the way to the tea garden or elsewhere. The white tea is delicious, the vibe is ideally San Franciscan, and the food is top notch. Try the turkey sandwich with jam spread; it hits the spot.
author: Clay C.

description:
I'm slightly stunned that this place got four stars. We came here yesterday and were excited to give it a try and the cafe was packed and buzzing. 

We had the BALT (bacon, avocado, lettuce, tomato) sammie, Peasant Pie w/feta and spinach, Granola, Bagel with cream cheese. With the exception of the BALT, we found that our picks were mediocre and poorly prepared. 

First off, biggest complaint: FROZEN food. You can tell when veggies/fruit was previously frozen and defrosted. Maybe not in say a spinach Peasant Pie but, seriously I'll notice if my cucumber slices and strawberries are translucent, water logged and soggy. It STUNS me to think that Velo Rouge would serve previously frozen strawberries in a granola bowl and soggy cucumbers in my side salad. Instant no-no and careless. 

Second off, the Peasant Pie? Sounded interesting and tasted interestingly bad. The filling at potential but, the dough ruined it for us. It was chewy and tasted stale and not the right pastry for a Peasant Pie. 

Third off and final straw was the bagel. Nobody even bother to spread the cream cheese. It was literally cut off the block they have and sandwiched in between the bagel. They didn't even think to give us a butter knife to spread it ourselves when our order came. 

Honestly, I am disappointed in this restaurant and largely because of the lack of attention to detail and bad quality ingredients they serve their customers. Not coming back again and wouldn't recommend it to anyone.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I wish the staff were nicer...
If they were it would be my favorite coffee spot ...Nice coffee, decent food, nice decor/vibe, good location ect...
I live nearby and have been coming here periodically for years , and unfortunately - for some reason that I can't figure out - the staff are consistenly rude and snotty. 
My guess is that as they come and go the new folks catch the rude, too-cool, vibe from the outgoing staff....
It's a shame, because it spoils an otherwise good place.
Fortunately there are hundreds of other places to get coffee in town so I can go somewhere else , and they always seem busy here so they don't need my custom.
author: j b.

description: Love this place.  Great coffee (currently Stumptown).  Their breakfast burrito is pretty legit, but everything there is good.  They have a wider menu on the weekends. We usually go for breakfast/lunch/brunch or coffee, but occasionally will get a beer in the afternoon.  Apparently they have pizza and live entertainment some evenings, but I haven't been, so this review is limited to breakfast/brunch/lunch.
author: Anthony D.

description: Breakfast here is really good and the atmosphere is mostly locals and USF students.
author: Rosie G.

description: The people are fantastic! The food is great amd wholesome as is their message. Hennessy amd Kerri are some of the best staples of the neighborhood and all the people who work there are pretty awesome. Ask Hennessy to make you latte art! The sandwiches amd salads taste great but it is the music and performances on the weekends that give the whole neighborhood a kitschy and fun vibe. Check it out and don't forget to tip your barista.
author: Marina M.

description:
When I moved in down the street I made note of the cleverly decorated cafe (there's a red bike that rests above the door to match its name). But, I when I finally made it down there I knew it would become a second home. 

On my virgin voyage here, I had ordered a coffee and a toasted whole wheat bagel. I know myself to be overly eager and burn myself drinking coffee on the regular, so I went to town on the bagel first. Honestly, I'm not sure what the fuck kind of cream cheese they use, but it was like a creamy heaven in my mouth (yes... I know). I mourned its end for a moment and I nearly forgot about my coffee. Then came the second "wow" of my visit. I had wondered why my coffee took so long, but after taking a sip and looking back towards the register, I saw the Blue Bottle logo. Skipping the long winded praise, it was awesome.

Since then, I have gone there an embarrassing amount of times in a short time period. There's a great mix of people of who come through here, which is great for people watching while I get some work done. Also, despite it being seemingly crowded all the time, I haven't had any trouble getting a spot. The staff are extremely friendly, something I can't understand when they are so busy. 

I'd recommend this place to people passing through, but please don't come here often... I want  a place to sit.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Came here with my intern to do some side work before we tried one of the future issues posted on the website. 

To share my experience via Yelp, we sat down and ordered the Breakfast Burrito (an alternative to their Mt. Ventoux, which they ran out of that day) to hold our appetites over before our dinner experience:

(http://instagram.com/p/c7qDsjnhyC/)

The burrito was bland, there wasn't enough flavor from the components that I got from the components wrapped around the tortilla. The salsa and chips made up for the lack of seasoning. However I am almost positive you can make a great tasting burrito for less than $10.00 and this burrito fell short with me.

Another interesting as mentioned to me by their cashier was shared via Yelp Tip and I quote,

"They shut off wi-fi during peak hours. Beware active laptop users." 

I guess I understand where they're coming from given they have limited seating and they want to accommodate other folks (like myself) who isn't necessarily local or from the area to enjoy the place. One thing's for certain if you have a constant crowd of locals in addition to the students from USF, you're bound to have laptop users.

FTR, it took me a good half an hour to forty minutes in connecting to the local wi-fi despite peak hour rush was already settling down.

Overall, this place a quaint cafe with the traditional selection of cafe beverages, breakfast plates and off the wall wi-fi issues. It wouldn't be fair to judge them solely on these two components without really digging deep into their craft of coffee before providing a final rating. So I'll stick with a 3 for now.
author: Ryan M.

description:
The food is good, but the fact that they're not willing to substitute anything knocks off points.

Even more so when they say they can remove the English Muffin, but will charge me for an extra egg... Last time I checked English Muffins cost a wee bit more than 1 egg.

Ambiance is ok - but you get a lot of pretentious bicycle riders (you know the ones who wear spandex 24/7
author: Richard B.

description: This small corner cafe is very welcoming. The staff is attentive, friendly, and thoughtful. With free WiFi, it is a great place to sit and work, with excellent coffee and baked goods. If you are in the USF area, the short walk down the hill to the Velo Rouge is well worth it.
author: Christopher L.

description: One of the best coffee shops you'll find in the city. The service is top notch. Tables are cleaned the instant customers get up to leave. Floors are swept the instant a crumb falls on the floor. Customers are greeted with smiles. I know this because I couldnt help but watch as I studied here on a warm Sunday afternoon. The decor is really unique! They have this really cool couch which appears to be made from bicycles. There is also outdoor seating! The bathrooms are kept clean and even smelling nice. The food is Amazing!!!! The ordered a tuna melt with a house side salad. The tuna melt literally melts in your mouth and the side salad is very fresh and healthy. The salad consists of corn, sliced apples, strawberries, cucumbers, and fresh greens with a olive oil and lemon vinegrette. The hot cocoa here is to die for. I have been searching all my life for a good rich hot cocoa and have never be successful until I came here. Their hot cocoa is legit and not watered down like you would most likely find at other coffeeshops in the city. I definitely recommend this place to study or for lunch dates with friends. Warning: They turn off their internet during lunch to prevent people with laptops from staying too long.
author: Amy T.

description: I don't think I can have mochas anywhere else after this place. How can a mocha be this good?!?? Friendly staff, clean place, they always make pretty designs on your mochas and lattes w the steamed milk. The pastries are good and today I'm ordering f their food for the first time!
author: Antara B.

description:
This was my first stop here in SF the following morning. My friend Yelped this place and I went here blindly. I didn't know what to expect and what may happen. 

This time traveling in SF, too!

Anyway, came here around noon, but was craving breakfast food. Luckily, breakfast menu is served all day. Lunch menu starts serving at 10:30am. The menu is limited, like having a several dishes per section but definitely tasteful.

I so happened to crave coffee and got the ice coffee, and didnt think it would taste any different, but after adding my creamer and sugar, one sip: OH EM GEEE! First thought that I uttered was "holy crap shit this is so good!" A local came and sat with us and asked me if I enjoyed the coffee and I was shouting YES! Lol! 

For food I ordered their breakfast burrito, surprisingly filling but not on the heavy side. You know when you eat something so fatty and heavy you feel like crap afterwards? Not the case. Vegetarian too! So win-win! And not to mention the burrito was loaded with potatoes! Yay! I requested the beans out because definitely not down with the beans. 

The venue is small by the way. A few seatings outdoor, but it's weird since its uphill too. Very cute and lovely cafe! Love the fact that its smacked right in the neighborhood! (: 

Wanna go back for the coffee! :D
author: Chary S.

description:
Once a weekend, I walk over to this neighborhood staple for some bomb coffee. I love Velo Rouge and all of the creaky, quirky crampedness of it; it's so homey and the baristas feel like old friends.

It gets crowded around brunch time (shocker) but I love slipping in during their off-hours to read or write there. It's also a great place to grab a Happy Hour drink if you live in the area, as an alternative to fighting the crowds downtown. On one of the rare sunnier days, it's perfect for sitting at one of their outdoor tables to people-and-dog-watch (this is SF after all). 

It draws in a diverse crowd of regulars in the neighborhood, from un-jaded twenty-somethings and more-jaded thirty-somethings, to avid cyclists speeding by, to young families in the area. Simply put, it's a solid gem in the Inner Richmond.
author: Meredith C.

description: Visiting from out of town with friends and looking for a great brunch place. Well, we found it! This place is really cute and the food is fantastic. I had the McAllister Scramble Sandwich, and it was seriously amazing, so flavorful, and a perfect portion. I would definitely recommend this to anyone in the area. Absolutely worth a visit!
author: Diana U.

description:
I will not be back. The breakfast burrito was underwhelming. Outside was awesome but the inside was missing a few items that were described on the menu.

The coffee was great but the service of staff member behind the counter was poor. After messing up our order by clearly not listening to what was being ordered and watching 2 other orders improperly taken, it became quickly apparent we would not return.

Coffee is great, food is ok, service not so much.
author: Adam H.

description: Stopped there a few days ago for a quick bite. The sandwich was yummy and the salad was fresh. The host was friendly and welcoming.
author: Leyla H.

description: Good company + live music + cold beer= as good as it gets. They have some pretty delicious sandwiches as well. I will post a photo soon!
author: Lisa L.

description: Cozy, cute and the best breakfasts we have had in a while. Warm, excellent service and welcoming atmosphere.
author: Kelly H.

description:
We came here two weeks ago for takeout and really liked it, decided to come back today and invited some friends.

The food was great, but I have to say I was really disappointed with the service.  There were two mistakes: a misunderstanding about something ordered, and they forgot to make my friend's breakfast, so he had to wait extra long.  No problem, mistakes happen. It's how they dealt with it that was so disappointing.

When my friend first asked the about the mistaken order, the lady that brought it out was really flippant, suggesting she was really too busy bringing out food and couldn't deal with us.  We asked what could be done and she said he should go find her manager. She left in a rush and didn't come back. She happened to walk by again a few minutes later and my friend asked if she had asked her manager to stop by - she said no. (??) She gave more attitude but finally talked to her manager.

The manager stopped by and my friend explained the situation and left out how unnecessarily rude the lady was.  This didn't seem right, so I mentioned her surprising attitude to the manager.  He blew me off by saying how they were correcting the order. That wasn't my point.

Overall I was disappointed with the manager's attitude about it.  Yes, he did correct the two mistakes (the misunderstanding about the order, and eventually delivered the missing plate),  but that is table stakes for a restaurant.  There was never an apology for her unnecessary rude behavior or even an acknowledgement that anything was wrong with her attitude.  

She was so terrible that the neighboring table even commented to us that it was the worst service they had ever witnessed. 

Not somewhere I'll be rushing back to...
author: vanessa e.

description:
I was really disappointed in the service and coffee today. The coffee was bitter, when I asked the staff what coffee they brewed they said blue bottle and that they always follow their methods. They continued to say, I don't know what to tell you and stared at me. Just expected more from a place with 4 stars.

Update: Went up to get some food, been here awhile studying, and they gave me a complimentary glass of wine for the coffee. I guess I just caught them at a bad time or something re: situation above.
author: Shawna P.

description: Nice breakfast joint.  Great location if you plan to walk around in Golden Gate Park.  Very good prices, fresh ingredients, and very generous portions.  Indoor and outdoor seating.  Great Cappuccinos.
author: Song H.

description: I love this place since its close to campus, and its not too pricey. I usually grab the mcallister scramble and a chai latte to go. It's perfect for any time of the day! My only issue is that the line can get pretty long around meal times so its kinda cramped if you're planning to eat in. My advice, try to sit outside if its sunny. The food is brought out to you and you can sit with more space and enjoy the bright day!
author: Stephanie R.

description: I've never eaten in, so I won't comment on their theme (and that probably works in their favor), but my breakfast and sandwich were delicious.  I'll have to try more things, and hopefully, Sarah will help me with that come May.
author: John S.

description:
Breakfast Burrito review only!

OK so this is currently my favorite breakfast burrito in SF.  But dammit it's far from my place!  The breakfast burrito here is tasty and by default comes w/avocado, peppers, black beans, sour cream, potatoes, and of course eggs and cheese.

The tortilla is toasted and slightly crunchy on the edges which is a nice touch.  The ingredients also taste really fresh which makes a huge difference.  It's a nice cafe too and serves Blue Bottle for the coffee folks out there.  I love the bike motif too of course as an avid cyclist. 

Ah if only Velo Rouge was closer!  Guess I have a reason to bike out there.  And they serve the breakfast burritos all day!
author: Gene X.

description:
Blue Bottle coffee, yes!

Cute little neighborhood spot; nice and genuine staff! Definitely coming back...
author: Bogee B.

description: Amazing environment, amazing food, and amazing prices. First time in SF in a while and I found this place on yelp and saw a lot of recommendations for the breakfast burrito so I had to try it. If you're vegetarian you'll love it, if you're not, you'll still love it. If you need some meat in your burrito throw some bacon, ham, or sausage in there. The chips and salsa it came with were absolutely great, just wish they gave more salsa. But it was good enough that my family ordered a side plate of just chips and salsa. Very good small sit down and recommend it for anyone who's hungry, or maybe just wants a cup of coffee (their iced coffee is really good too).
author: Eddie S.

description:
This is one of my go-to cafes, because it's in my neighborhood and accepts the SFBC member card for a 10% discount. Plus, they sell my friend's "53 miles per burrito" t-shirts and display another one of my friend's bikey photography. So yeah, it's a bike-friendly cafe. Expect to see lots of lycra passing through.

The food and coffee is decent, but nothing spectacular compared to other cafes in the area. The free WiFi is nice, though they'll randomly shut it off if there are too many people hogging it.

You really have to get your timing right if you plan to hang out there and drink/eat, because it's small and can get super crowded. Plus, you run the risk of them screwing up your order (especially if you get it to-go) during the crowded rush periods. My advice? Aim for early morning -- meaning before 9:30 am -- or between meal times. I've never gone in the evening, so I can't comment on their libations and clientele during that time. I did get the distinct pleasure of watching a drunk woman order and drink a Stella at 10 am, but I think episodes like that are few and far-between.

Overall, I recommend Velo Rouge for its coffee, decent breakfasts, and atmosphere.
author: Tracy J.

description:
I love Velo Rouge for its location, its food, and its prices. The atmosphere is nice and inviting - you can sit and eat with friends or bring your laptop and get some work done. I like that. It's your basic coffeehouse feel with the benefit of a far more elaborate menu. And you can sit outside.

As for the food, the breakfast burrito is legendary. There's no meat, just an array of egg/cheese/bean goodness with more surprises and guacamole.

And if you want to go healthier, their granola is really excellent too. I think you can get it with either yogurt or milk, though I've always opted for the yogurt, and it comes with fruit piled high, all chopped and arranged. Also, it's pretty cheap for such a huge amount (definitely less than five bucks).

They have Blue Bottle Coffee, which is really good. And of course you've got soy milk, cold drinks, liquor... everything and more.
author: Jiordan C.

description:
I got a chocolate chip cookie here. Still thinking of you, cookie. Maybe we can hang out again sometime. Deliciously dense. 

Beer on tap, free wi-fi and really cool bike motif. My only complaint is that it's a little small and one of the employees got off work and wanted to hang out a little longer, so she had to sit with me at my table while we both ignored each other. I felt bad, but that's just a testament to how hoppin' it is.
author: Sam D.

description:
THE BEST CAFE!!!!!!!

I live in the NoPa and whenever friends come visit me, Velo Rouge is a right of passage to SF cafe's.

You can bring your doggy and sit outside =) They have a nice little water bowl for the pooches.

COFFEE:

They serve blue bottle coffee and fabulous espresso!

FOOD: 

EAT THE BREAKFAST BURRITO!!! so yummy- never disappoints
My friend and I also love the banana pancakes when we are in the right mood =)

I highly recommend this place to anyone in the area... it is great quality cafe food and yummy coffee!!!

STAFF:
Always friendly

VIBE:
I also love the bicycle theme, Very SF
Cozy and cute cafe. Inside and outside seating.

The place is always busy and you will see why!
author: Angela I.

description:
blue bottle. breakfast burrito. beer

I used to live down the street from this place for a year and I came in all the time. the pizzas here are really good if you're in the neighborhood on a week night + they always have two beers on tap and it's a fun place to sit around.  they have tons of board games and on the weekends they show Premier League matches (if you're lucky enough to get a seat) - it's busy as ever on the weekends.
pro tip - order ahead, walk over to the Conservatory of Flowers - basque
author: Daniel C.

description: So glad I discovered this spot- it's going to become my weekend hangout. The breakfast burrito was one of the best I've had- eggs, beans, avocado, cheese, and potato. It was accompanied by salsa, and they also have a bunch of sauces like tabasco and sriracha to make it even more delicious. Excellent blue bottle coffee. My pancakes were perfectly fluffy and buttery, and they came with a small side of fresh berries. There's a bar by the window and seating outside to enjoy a warm sunny day- take a stroll in the park after to walk off the deliciousness.
author: Pria P.

description:
My boyfriend and I slept in too late and missed brunch at Red Door Cafe, so we just yelped for a nice outdoor seating lunch area since it was a beautiful day in the city. We found Velo Rouge and just decided to come here. 

It's a small cafe, self-served tables and outdoor seating. The food was pretty good. I had an Arguello breakfast. Simply just ham, eggs, toast. I guess you can't really mess up on this order. Also had a glass of mimosa which turned me bright red in public in broad daylight. -___- Maybe I should have just stuck with a latte, which seems highly rated here.

I loooved sitting outside and seeing all the doggies pass by!
author: Rosanne L.

description:
I did a job for this sweet little cafe about a week ago (lock work) and the owners where absolutely exceptionally sweet! The offered food over and over again and did anything they could to be sure I was comfortable. So a week later I gave in. THIS FOOD IS AMAZING. It takes "San Francisco Eats" to a whole new level. For the cost and quality this place is without a doubt the place to go! 

I love this place and will be back again and again whenever I am doing jobs in the city. And guys....if you are into the cute cafe hangout girl? Then this place is filled with gorgeous people! What more could you ask for? I give them a solid 10 gold stars but yelp only allows 5.....
author: Ford B.

description:
Stopped here one day my way to the GG Bridge to grab a coffee. It was the best cafe au lait I could remember.

Stopped again a few months later, once again on my way to the GG Bridge, the second was as good as the first, and the people were really nice.
author: Patrick O.

description: Love this place! Breakfast burrito is really good. Their coffee is good too, it's blue bottle coffee :) The place is sometimes busy but still worth the wait. They have water for my dog too :) You can sit outside on nice sunny days.
author: David L.

description: Beer AND coffee- what more could you want? Really nice staff, good service, food is great (recommend the breakfast burrito), great coffee and tea. No pretense!
author: Lauren M.

description: Great coffee, great food, friendly staff, nice location (near GG Park) but pretty small and often crowded, even with the sidewalk seating.
author: Jeff B.

description:
Getting my passive-agressive whining out of the way. 

I go to cafes to work, tech startup life with no office. So when I find one with wifi and good food that is a nice bike ride from my house I am stoked. 

VR has free wifi and I love the breakfast burrito. 

My complaint. They turn the wifi off randomly. You are sitting there working, enjoying yourself, drinking coffee and eating your burrito. Then, whammo!, no internet. Then you are just sitting there like a jackass with no way to get anything done. 

@VeloRouge - if you posted a schedule of when wifi would be unavailable it would help me figure out when to go to your cafe. Now I am forced to go elsewhere because of the uncertainty. Bad for me, bad for you. I get that Friday afternoons are crazy and weekend brunch is too busy for everyone to be on their laptops taking up too much space. Just let me know what the heck is going on and I wouldn't be all huffy about it. Even coming up and letting me know in person that it is getting to busy and your will be turning the wifi off in 10 min would be fine.

There, I did it.
author: Jason M.

description:
Velo Rouge is good, but it's not exceptional. I've been here twice now. The first time, I ordered their vegetarian panini with cream cheese. The second time, I had the Coppi sandwich. Both dishes came with a great side salad. Unfortunately, I just don't think either were anything more than ordinary. I definitely could have made the Coppi at home with my own panini press. I also ended up adding quite a bit of Sriracha, which is another sign that a dish lacks flavor. On the upside, I've never had a greasy meal here. The food always tastes fresh

The best part about this little cafe is its decor. I love the little table and seats made from bicycle parts! Great theme but average food.
author: Anna N.

description:
Cute place. Pretty good espresso drinks. I didn't have food, but friends did and they liked it. Patrons all pretty nice, people who work here seem pretty nice. Not inexpensive, and took forever to get my coffee ( someone with same name took mine, so they had to make mine over, and it had already been a long wait)
I'd go back, though, if I was planning to hang out. Go somewhere faster if you want coffee to go.
author: El B.

description:
Delicious!

I have only been here for brunch or coffee. Their brunch is great. One time they lost my ticket, but they remedied it quickly. Their coffee is always delicious (go blue bottle!)

It can get rather crowded here, but it's a wonderful place to hang out with a small group of friends!
author: Maggie F.

description:
A hidden gem in a great neighborhood! 

I was greeted with a bright smile and a welcoming attitude! I could tell that people that worked here were truly happy and genuinely friendly! Kinda rare in any cafe, I think!  I ordered a mocha and while they had it going I was able to use their bathroom - which was very tastefully decorated and very clean!! My mocha was one of the best I've tasted.

Thank you Velo Rouge!
author: Mercy D.

description: What a cute little cafe just off Golden Gate Park...with booze! I ride my bike often so I loved the cycling theme. Be mindful it closes early (5pm) a few days of the week, so check the hours before you head out. They run a happy hour from afternoon till close with $3.50 pints and $5 wine, so it's a great place to relax with a drink after a long day. You don't have to go out of your way to visit, but if you're in the area stop in for a bite or beverage.
author: Kyle W.

description:
YAAAYYYY!!!!! I love you guys.

I was so happy when I moved into the neighborhood and saw that I would have blue bottle coffee only a block away. I live for their cappuccinos. 

Also, they have a little stack of stamp cards right by the register that I didn't notice for a couple months... Don't make the same mistake I did! Grab a card and start racking up stamps.

A couple notes: Please start making the New Orleans style iced coffee! Also, why have a breakfast sandwich that you have to eat with a knife and fork? I WANT TO PICK IT UP WITH MY HANDS.

Thank you. That is all.
author: Jenny M.

description: Great homemade cornbread - one of the best, or maybe even the best I've ever had. It's lightly sweet and grill-toasted. Nice ambiance, fair prices. Reminds me of SF before the tech boom, which is always a good thing. I had the soup of the day and that only gets three stars at best - pretty bland for a coconut carrot yam soup. It needed lemon, salt, pepper and some curry to make it come alive.
author: B A.

description:
I got into town about 6:00 am with very little time to do sightseeing and needed a spot open early for coffee and a quick bite.  Thanks to Yelp, Velo Rouge came up and it was mercifully nearby...even better, there was a free parking spot just a short block from the front door.  

The Red Bike...sounded good to me.  I bicycle, so a bike-themed place was already appealing.  When I got there, they were open and playing hippie/folk music I remember fondly from my childhood.  And then the young ladies behind  the counter began playfully complaining about Christmas music already being played on the radio.  Okay, I was officially a fan at that point!   

The menu is bewilderingly large for such a tiny cafe (6 tables?  maybe eight?) and I just picked a sandwich at random along with a cafe Americano.  I was expecting a plastic-wrapped deli sandwich.  But then the coffee arrived.

Well now, that was a cup of joe, nice and rich with a creamy head and enough of a jolt to clear away the morning drizzle.  And the cup was a hefty size, too, not the demitasse size one typically finds in boutique cafes.  My expectations for the sandwich began to rise.

When my food appeared, there was no plastic wrap in sight.  In fact, the 'sandwich' was open face, a toasted English muffin served on a plate and piled with creamy scrambled eggs, crumbled bacon, feta cheese (I think) and spinach greens.  On the side were home fries made from savory seasoned red potatoes.  

If you visit, be aware that the spot appears popular with local cyclists...I was just finishing as a pack of them appeared and immediately swamped the cafe!
author: Leland S.

description: Fantastic coffee and food. Laid back atmosphere and good prices. Truly a gem in the Richmond. Stop by for a quick bite in the morning or a pint in the afternoon!
author: Andrew S.

description: Came into this quaint little cafe looking for a good espresso.  I was very disappointed. The espresso was awful. The service was excellent and the atmosphere was great. It was after I drank the foul swill coffee I notice it was Blue Bottle Coffee. I will  say I will come back the food I'd great and the people very nice. Next time I will have a cold beer.
author: Steve K.

description:
Really 3.5.

I like that Velo is a cozy, neighborhood cafe. They have an extensive menu for such a small place, and the menu runs the gamut from breakfast foods to snack-sized savory pies to pizzas (available at night). Generally I think the food is good and most of it is priced reasonably (large bowl of fresh-made soup and hunk of corn bread for under $5, for example). The staff has always been polite to me. The cafe and bathroom are clean. I love that they have happy hour, with wine/beer available for late afternoon study sessions. 

The size can be frustrating. Many times, at lunch or even late afternoon, I've had to leave because it's full. Although they promote a "share your space" policy, not everyone is friendly and it's not uncommon to have folks take up a large table by themselves. The size also leads to another gripe- they turn the WiFi off a lot. They want to turn tables, I get it, but the WiFi seems to be off more than it's on (certainly 12-2, usually mid-afternoon to 4 as well. Lots of times on weekends.). This makes it tricky to use Velo as a reliable place to get work done (for the record I will usually work for about an hour and a half to two hours and spend about $20). 

Finally, although their beverages are good, they are, as others note, really tiny for the price. A chai latte runs about $4.50 and might be even a bit smaller than a "tall" at a chain shop. Honestly, the wine/beer specials seem to be a better deal :)
author: Jenni D.

description:
I come here way too much, but that's because it's the best breakfast burrito in the city. And no offense to Blue Bottle, but Velo Rouge makes their coffee better then they do. I don't know what their secret is.

You really can't go wrong here. With anything. Seriously. Even when the line is out the door, they never are off their game.
author: Mark C.

description:
My college years cafe.  Now I am back in the neighborhood, and went for a visit the other day.  I was wild about their blue bottle coffee.  However, I have been ruined for all other coffee's and coffee shops by PHILZ. 

The coffee was not bad, it is way better than your average cup of Joe, but not as tasty as I remembered it.  

Anyways, I like the concept, the food is good, ok selection of snacks and beers, clean, cute. But, uncomfortable to chill in, slow service, and sometimes that way to "boho" crowd.  I do not know if boho is the right word but thats what comes to mind when I see people with their lap tops and kids in strollers hanging out in the sun during the middle of the day drinking a belgian beer.
author: Chelsey G.

description: I've been going to this place quite a bit since it is across the street from the place we are staying this summer. Their lattes are excellent! I dream about these lattes! The food is excellent as well. I love their breakfast burrito. It's so big I can usually do one half for breakfast and the other half for lunch. The only slight complaint is that sometimes their is a little unfriendliness from one of the employees. I've probably gone about a dozen times now and if that employee is not there, the atmosphere is great. If he is, I don't feel as good about the place. It's nothing that he does in particular he just seems like he's annoyed that you are there ordering coffee from him. It won't stop me from coming and the rest of the staff is excellent. I don't like being critical of places I really like, but I think that if I had just come in here one time and he had been here I would have had a different review. But otherwise, really, really great! :)
author: Midori H.

description:
Great selection of beer, including chimay. 
Food is definitely is excellent for a cafe. Had a pesto pizza and it was amazing. I was on sat early evening, there was a band playing. They also have a small "terrasse" outside. 
They close at 5PM on sunday (unfortunately).
author: Yann L.

description: I'm a sucker for a good breakfast and cup of mocha.  Velo rouge cafe has very friendly staff and great coffee.  If you're ever hungover or have some hardcore munchies, Velo rouge is your best bet for eggs and coffee.  I ordered the Mcallister scramble with a mocha coffee.  It was a basic omelet with sautéed mushrooms onions and spinach topped with goat cheese and with some baked potatoes coated in dill and paprika.  All on top of 2 buttermilk pancakes.  Simple and delicious.  What blew me away even more was their mocha.  It had the perfect ratio of espresso to cocoa mix.  I ordered another mocha because it was so good.  Overall very affordable and very delicious cafe.  Definitely going back there for brunch with friends.
author: Victor E.

description:
This is a quaint little cafe near Golden Gate Park with a lot of vegetarian (and even vegan!) options. My boyfriend got a breakfast burrito (which was more like a breakfast burrito panini... still delicious) and I got a turkey panini with spinach & some sort of jam. Both tasted fresh, and I loved that my panini came with a side salad instead of chips/fries. The salad was very good (it wasn't just some old lettuce that they threw together) and I love the pepper-y vinaigrette that was on it.

The ambiance is a bit junky-chique, but it works for the cafe. We really enjoyed our meal here (you order at the counter and they give you a number kind of a deal), and we'll keep this place in mind when going to the park in the future!
author: Kate B.

description:
Perfectly placed near the GG Park...this is THE place to come to kick start your day with some COFFEE and to pick up a sandwich to picnic in the park with friends or with your S.O.  Of course, you can just meet up there for brunch and some MIMOSAS.  

It is a mixed weekend crowd and a tiny space; therefore, on a sunny day...expect to wait...or to take your lunch "to go".  There are students, locals, visitors...the whole gamut.  Everyone is generally in a good mood and about to go do leisurely activities in the park.    Haven't been here for several months...but this was a nice place for coffee, a book and some "me" time...Nothing fancy, nothing too outrageous...moderately priced...if you're on a budget, just grab a cup of joe and sit and people watch.
author: Hiromi N.

description:
My friends & I came here after finishing up one of our finals to celebrate winter break :) 

It was like 10:30am & it was pretty crowded in there. We found seats at the tables outside. We went inside to order. To our surprise, they had mimosas!! :) That's what we wanted, but didn't think they would have them for some reason. But yayy that they did! :) & I also got a poppyseed muffin. Both items were really good! :) Very satisfying. 

Customer service was great. The woman working the register was really nice to us. She created small conversation. & they brought our food outside when it was ready. 

Really enjoyed our visit here. I'm sure we'll be back one of these days.
author: Jessica A.

description:
After our bike ride through Golden Gate Park we were looking for a place to stop for lunch.
We rode by Velo Rouge and stopped to read some reviews first.  All were good, so we went in.
So glad we did.  Excellent food, friendly staff, nice sidewalk seating.
We had the McAllister scramble, the Coppi, and the Club.  All excellent choices, and good portions.  Our son and I both took half of our sandwiches home with us.
Make sure to try this place, you won't be disappointed.
author: Helen A.

description:
Looks can be deceiving.  

It looks like a sleepy little corner coffee shop.  But step inside on an evening when there is a live band, and you get a whole different impression.  The event I attended was part inspirational music, part campfire singing, part open mike night.  There were sing-alongs, special requests, and excellent musicians from around the country.  

The coffee was fine.  I ordered a couple of lattes for myself, and a couple of glasses of white wine for the Love of My Life.  

But wait.  They feature a sandwich, at the top of the menu, that is simply a must-try.  It's like a croque-monsieur on a croissant. Yeah, evil.  Everybody wanted a bite.
author: David D.

description:
Pretty good! Fresh ingredients, good presentation and colors. This place really tries to make their customers feel satisfied about the quality of their food and about their experience sitting in the cafe. 

All sandwiches come with a salad, which is great. I ordered a veggie sandwich and it's all fresh ingredients, it's just yummy. And they use some unique ingredients like beets in the sandwiches and strawberries and some other berries in the salad to make it sweet. Creative and thoughtful.

People are always here around 6pm when I stop by, because of the happy hour. $4 wine and beer I think? People are just sitting and relaxing, alone or with company with a glass of wine. Good environment.

The only bad thing is it's pricey. $13 for sandwich and coffee.
author: Emily M.

description:
I adore this place.  My sister lives right down the street so it's an easy way to get breakfast in the morning here.  They offer a variety of coffee drinks which is nice, because they'll always have what you crave.

My absolute favorite dish is the McAllister Scramble.  You really get the bang for your buck here.  The house potatoes are delicious, but the side salad is also good.  However, be aware that they only give you a lemon to dress your salad, but the fresh fruits are a nice replacement for that.  Everything I've tried on the menu has been good.  I would say that the actual dishes are more worth getting in comparison to the easy breakfast sandwich or bagel, because it's not that much food for barely less money.  I've also had two soups of the day, and both have been very good.  Helps make me feel better when I'm feeling a little sickly.

Definitely recommend this place to the surrounding neighborhoods.  Such a cute place to come and dine and chat.
author: My An V.

description:
Cute and casual. 
The BLT with avocado was so good! It was gigantic as well. Nice service; they try to prepare your drink/coffee first so that you can sip it while waiting for your food. People who live nearby that frequent this cafe are really friendly and add to the nice atmosphere.
The only thing that I didn't like was the lack of seating (this place is poppin' on weekends!). Other than that it's golden.
author: Idk A.

description:
Velo rouge is a cute little coffee shop with tasty food. The blue bottle latte was delicious. I had a blueberry muffin that was a little dry and I probably wouldn't get it again. I also had the ham and cheese sandwich (mercokx) which was delicious. It had a refreshing little salad on the side. I spent about 16 dollars on all of this and there's a 50 cent charge if you use a credit card for a purchase under 10 dollars. 
It was hard to get a seat at first because it was crowded but once you snatch one it's great. Not many people come here to work but there are lots of children and people having conversations. The employees are also super friendly. 
I will be coming back!
author: Emily T.

description: After passing by this place on bicycle many, many times, finally took a day off the bike and was able to walk here.  Note: the irony about this bike themed cafe is that it's a hot spot for bike thievery.  Anyway, I was really impressed with the quality if food for such a small place.  Their sandwiches and peasant pies also came with greens on the side, which is a nice touch.  I really enjoyed the the grilled corn bread that came with the soup.  Good place for an afternoon drink and snack.
author: Ash T.

description:
I wasn't too impressed with the omelettes but the portions are large. The peasant pies were too dry. 

This place is packed on Sunday for brunch so finding a spot to sit down is hard.
author: LeTran B.

description:
You''d think it would be really cool to have a themed cafe a half block from home.

I wish it were.  I've tried going in several times.  The service is insanely slow.  30-45 minutes for toasted bagel to go.  Wow!  The food is mediocre.  The menu just isn't interesting. 

Only hipsters and those who love them are really welcome here.  Expect a dismissive attitude otherwise.

The positive reviews for Velo Rouge are probably accurate but if you're not a Mission District transplant trying to turn the Inner Richmond into the next hipster zone, this place may not be for you.

But, if that describes what you're looking for then, Voila!  C'est si bon!
author: Nadine J.

description:
I got the veggie sandwich. Two weeks ago. I'm still thinking about it. 

I lived in the neighborhood about a decade ago. Man, I would have loved for this place to be around back then. Now it's kind of a trek for me. Maybe I'll call a task rabbit.
author: A K.

description: Excellent for breakfast and brunch. They serve great food, Blue Bottle coffee, beer, and mimosas. It gets a little crowded and there might be a short line getting to the counter.
author: Brian M.

description: What a sweet little place! I am a cyclist, so I was attracted to the bicycle theme going on here, and walked through the doors. The first thing that hit me was the bright, authentic smile on the girl at the counter, and she was very helpful explaining my choices. The food was very tasty, well prepared and healthy. I sat at the table made out of a bicycle because it looked like fun, but I suggest more comfortable seating at other tables. As I started to eat, musicians began to set up, and proceeded to play some very nice bluegrass.
author: David B.

description: I love Velo Rouge because it is for me like the old "Cheers" bar: friends that get together for good cheer, great food, and lots of fun. The owner is fantastic, Adam runs a great ship, and the staff is wonderful: smart, young, polite and extremely friendly.
author: Stephen B.

description:
Always a favorite spot for either breakfast, lunch or even an afternoon snack.  

Love their sandwiches, the BLTA is one of my favorites. Nice that it comes with a side salad.
author: Dilly M.

description: I had the arguillo breakfast, the eggs were bland as where the potatoes. They turned of the free wifi because it was busy and they didn't want people to stay longer than needed, but free wifi was one of the reason I chose this place. All in all, I wouldn't come back here,  as I had to force myself to finish this plate.
author: Natascha W.

description:
Good little place, it was very crowded but we were able to get a table. 
Service is ultra-friendly and fast. We had the Coppi: turkey sandwiches with a salad on the side: good and hearthy. 
A good lunch, near Golden Gate Park.
author: Sylvie C.

description: Hipster schmipster. Overused word that needs to go away. This place has great coffee, great food, great beer on tap, and great people. Such a neighborhood fixture and a perfect place to park during a rare sunny day in the Richmond. The wine could use some improvement, but meh.
author: Roman H.

description:
I go WAY out of my way for their Veggie sandwhich. Oh man, it is SO good. SO good. 

Also - the milky heart on my au lait pretty much made my week.
author: Leah P.

description:
Great neighborhood cafe that not only serves Blue Bottle coffee and draft beers!
Serves dinner on select nights and even has live local music acts. 
I do wish they would serve coffee in bigger cups and use some other method that pouring through a cone by hand, but that also makes it charming.
author: Mark F.

description: I love velo rouge: location, ambiance, people watching, wait staff, music events, coffee... Most of the food. The tuna salad they use on the tuna melt is disgusting and should not exist. It's sweet and has apples in it. Please change your tuna salad recipe!!!
author: Mary V.

description: I ordered The Coppi sandwich (turkey, spinach, cranberry sauce and cheese). Worst sandwich I ever had. There were two leaves of spinach, literally two leaves between those two pieces of bread. It was overloaded with turkey and that's all I could taste.
author: Jasmina T.

description: The breakfast burritos used to be amazing. Not sure what happened. The last few times I've been they had no flavor whatsoever. Kinda tasted like the frozen kind you buy at the grocery store. Bleh.
author: Holly E.

description: Wife and I visited on a Saturday. Very nice bicycle type decor but very limited seating. Wife ordered eggs over easy and they were so well done that they looked like the plastic eggs from a child's cooking toy set. While the cup of coffee was good, when I went back to counter for a refill, I expected to pay something and was shocked when told I had to pay full price for second cup. If I had known that I would have asked for a clean cup and not reused my glass mug.
author: Rick Y.

description:
Good service. Good food presentation. Quick food  and it's relatively cheap. 

However the quality of the food isn't the greatest. I ordered the French toast and unfortunately it wasn't very tasty. May be you'll have better luck with an egg dish.
author: Abhi M.

description:
I just discovered this place as I live just down the street from it.  Whenever I used to drive by it seemed to be crackin so I thought I would check it out.  The coffee is quite tasty and the breakfast sandwiches are really good.  They offer an assortment of pastries, bagels and lunch sandwiches as well.  I was even able to get salt and vinegar Tayto here, which is nice since I don't have to go to the Irish specialty foods store.

They have free wifi and indoor/outdoor seating.  A lot of people bring dogs and sit outside with them.  Overall, great neighborhood coffee spot.
author: Aishling R.

description: Delicious breakfast burrito, good coffee, friendly staff and cool bike-friendly atmosphere. Only downside is that they turn off the Wi-Fi when it gets busy to discourage people from working. Will come again, maybe when I'm less busy or they are less busy!
author: Ken B.

description: hey HEY! This cafe is a sweet little spot for breakfast and a casual coffee in the morning. They do have a great variety of breakfast foods! All enjoyable. See some of the posted pictures to get a feel for the meal that you will enjoy! I didn't try their coffee or anything though.
author: Hamilton C.

description: Great coffee and atmosphere, the food is merely decent.  I'd like to give this 3.5 stars, but can't.  I feel the 5 star reviews, like many places on yelp, are from people who are stoked that this place is nearby them.  It's at least worth a try.
author: Carlin F.

description: Great service, great menu, good vibes. A little pricey for a cafe, but the product is always great. Love the egg sandwiches and the granola is great. Love their happy hours!
author: Laura C.

description:
Although I scanned the other reviews before selecting this café, I didn't understand how small it was. Like five tables small.  Very packed together five metal tables, so they aren't meant for comfort. So plan to get your items to-go if you are coming at peak hours, or be prepared to sit on hard chairs, or at one of the 3 bar stools.

The menu is very small and to the point. You go up and order your food at the counter, and then they bring it to you. I thought this was a regular sit down restaurant.  

I had a Bagel and Lox with cream cheese which came with red onions and capers.  A very generous portion of lox and cream cheese. It was delicious.  I also ordered a sesame bagel toasted with jelly for my two year old.  She doesn't eat much and no surprise, she didn't eat much of her bagel. I took a bite of her bagel and it did have a strange after-taste, almost like it picked up some of an onion bagel that was previously toasted.  That's a no-go for a two year old, but really, it was fine for anyone else to eat. I also didn't get a coffee on this date, which it sounds like they are fantastic at.  $2.50 for a drip coffee seemed pretty high, but their food prices seemed very reasonable.  My bagel with lox and cream cheese, plus my daughter's bagel came in at $9.00. 


I think the lunch options actually looked yummier than the small breakfast menu.  I wouldn't veer out of my way to eat her again, but its proximity to Golden Gate park made it ideal for my daughter and I to grab a quick breakfast, and then walk over to the California Academy of Sciences.
author: Amanda M.

description:
The food here is delicious, healthy and plentiful.  I am vegan and had a delicious cup of blended lentil, mushroom and chard soup, and a grilled veggie sandwich.  The sandwich and salad filled a large plate, and the salad is full of tasty goodies.  Ask them to hold the cheese and cream cheese on the sandwich, and also be sure to remind them to leave the cheese off the salad if you are seeking vegan food.  

Nice, fun atmosphere, though a little loud for quiet conversation or study at times.  Good coffee too.
author: Erica H.

description:
I haven't been here in a while but you know it's an amazing place when you're writing a review after a multi-month absence. I can not forget their Huevos Rancheros. It's the only place in the city I will actually get up early and drive to to get brunch. 

Aside from the one excellent dish I've had there, I'm not sure what draws me here. The decor is bike related, it's quaint-sized and the coffee is good bordering on great. Somehow everything clicks. Grab a spot outside and enjoy Arguello on a nice day. This is what I think of when I think of SF.
author: Pete F.

description:
it seems like half the staff here is simply phoning it it. hello? HELLO? 

the one dude that's always there--perhaps manager or owner?--is on top of his game all the time. great customer service. the rest of them? meh. i wouldn't hire them.
author: Shannon C.

description: I'm a big fan of this neighborhood place, with great service and food. Always feeling comfortable and at home with their atmosphere and decor. Great coffee and breakfast as well. Overall a unique experience that is near and dear to my heart.
author: Giancarlo S.

description:
If there was one food wish I had, it was that Velo Rouge would be open more nights a week.  

Now for the awesomeness - the breakfast burrito is terrific. The layers of egg goodness with creamy avocado, breakfast potatoes, black beans, and cheese makes for a filling brunch/breakfast. 

Their Club sandwich is a gigantic meal in itself, and the side salad it comes with is the best! It's the perfect light summery salad with berries and veggies!

This place has me totally spoiled, especially being less than a block away.
author: Apurva P.

description: I have been many times before for coffee, but on Sunday I had their breakfast burrito and woah, my life has changed forever. Best god damn breakfast burrito of my life. A perfect pairing of tender spiciness, toasted tortilla and gooey bliss inside.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Great neighborhoody spot! The service is awesome, and the vibe is mellow cool! Just get there at the right time cuz it can be jammed packed and that does not work. I love that I just strolled down there from my apt and as soon as I walk in, they greet my by name, know what I want and make you feel so welcome. An essential way to start the day for me! Thanks folks!

Miguelito
author: Miguelito C.

description:
The Blue Bottle coffee is great! 

I didn't enjoy the "Merckx" ham sandwich that I ordered.  A sandwich that plain needs good quality ingredients if it's going to be enjoyable. I couldn't finish it.   I like that the sandwich comes with a bit of salad, but my greens were a bit wilted.
author: Elle M.

description: I ordered the Mcallister scramble and vanilla latte to go. After I had finished my coffee and sat waiting then noticed people that had just walked in receiving their food. I absolutely hate when restaurants lose/forget my order then I'm stuck waiting watching everyone who ordered after me enjoy their meal. #1 pet peeve. Then after I remind them of my order I'm given my food cold with no apology. The food, after being microwaved, was decent. The coffee was good but definitely overpriced. There was also a charge for using a credit card which is always annoying.
author: Bianca L.

description:
Love this breakfast/early morning coffee spot. Velo Rouge has a variety of breakfast options: I opted for the breakfast burrito, naturally. It was delicious but if you're trying to hold a conversation it may not be the best option since it was a little bit messy (or maybe that's just me). 

I love the location because of the quiet neighborhood, as well. I will definitely be back next time I'm in the neighborhood!
author: Natalie R.

description:
Honestly to be 100 percent honest.... I only come here FOR SO MANY THINGSSSS!! 
1. Chill vibes, always made to feel welcome
2. Solid staff with some bomb ass dank ass lattes :) (however the latte art... lets just say it could use some work hehe) HOWEVER latte art does not a good latte make
3. Food is yum yum yum, really recommend the breakfast burrito, add extra 'cado because they understandably skimp on it (just a tad)

So to summarize, this place has chill vibes, good coffee, great food, and an even coolier staff.
author: Kevyn R.

description: Service was rude. They shut off the Internet without any warning, lost everything I was working on. Asked them to let us know next time and he shrugged me off coldly. Food is ok though.
author: Breee R.

description: Strong coffee, friendly staff, and delicious food. If you don't mind the occasional entitled dbag who holds up the line just to tell the barista how much he knows about coffee, this place is just fine. Just a bit on the pricey side.
author: Ben Z.

description: A fun neighborhood spot. Good simple good food. Its a comfy spot to pop over on bike or foot to get a reasonably priced lunch. They serve blue bottle coffee (for those fans out there)
author: Jenn D.

description: Nice little cafe with good pastries and nice breakfast sandwiches. The decor is really fun and focuses on the bike theme.
author: Anya A.

description:
After moving to sf I must say I was both excited and forlorn. All the new restaurants and amazing food that awaited me, but alas what of my old favorite haunts. The places that make you feel like family? 

In comes the velo cafe, right down the street from my apartment and down right amazing. With great coffee and a solid menu you really cannot go wrong here.  Service is great, the ambiance is lovely, and I have yet to have something less than phenomenal. Think I've found my new coffee shop.
author: Matthew L.

description:
Go here almost every weekend and love it. Fan of the coffee, even though it is a little pricey. The breakfast sandwich is delicious, especially with avocado. I get the yogurt & granola every time I go, it is perfect. They always have an array of fruit on the dish that changes each week, which I love. 
The atmosphere is super casual but can get crowded some mornings making it hard to find a table...sometimes we just take it to go and eat in front of arguello deli. Other than the high prices, everybody I know including myself loves this place. Always a good choice, consistently delicious.
author: Julia B.

description:
My favorite cafe in the city. 

I used to live right next to this cafe.. whenever i get lazy, i used to go down stairs and grab some food and coffee here. 

Every weekend, there is a line to get food/ drinks here. Why ? excellent food, amazing service( the employees here are so nice and kind, have great great smiles on their face ! makes me happy ) , nice atmosphere ( wish they had more outdoor seats ! ) 

Great happy hour deal pretty much everyday. Sometimes, they have live music or some type of gig going on during the week days.
author: Debbie S.

description:
Would give it 5 stars however this morning changed my mind 

Coffee and food are always great and normally the staff is pleasant and entertaining. However this morning was a completely different story. Barista was great. Latte is perfect. The cashier however spoke and acted like every order was a burden even though it was all orders straight of the menu. My guesses were that she was either incredible hungover, high or just shouldn't work at a coffee shop at 8 15am ( mind you at this point the shop had been open 15 minutes and it wasn't very busy). She barreled through the front door when I was leaving nearly hitting me with it and blasting through a toddler and her mother.
author: Stan D.

description:
Very very very nice place.
People at the counter were friendly, the coffee was good, the atmosphere pleasant and relaxed. A very nice place where to go for reading, relaxing or chit chat with a friend.
And no hipsters in annoyance range!! A huge plus!
author: Luca R.

description: 3.5 to be fair. Interesting place. I order the most popular dish, and was unimpressed. It was a nice croissant but nothing that special, and really small. So I was still hungry, and ordered the breakfast burrito, now that was good! I haven't had a breakfast burrito in ages, but this one was tasted great and I asked them to add bacon. This place had a great variety of chocolate also, not the regular type. My friends got sandwiches and said they were pretty good.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Velo Rouge is a neighborhood cafe. Pros include cleanliness, Blue Bottle Coffee and a comforting neighborhood feeling. It's located near Golden Gate Park and I will be pleased to share of it's existence next year during the Outside Lands Festival. 

I ordered the Arguello Breakfast  and it was simple. 
2 Eggs, Bacon, Toast & Potatoes. 

It was a bit bland but it did the job. It wasn't greasy and there is always something to say about that. 

The cafe was cramped but people were very polite. The music playing quietly in the background was a pleasant distraction from the swinging front door , kids laughing and tight spaces.

Charming.
author: Hannah A.

description:
I came to Velo Rouge on a whim after hiking around Twin Peaks with some friends. By far, the cutest little neighborhood cafe I've stumbled upon lately. I had the brunch special which was french toast topped with fresh strawberries, blueberries, and banana--very reasonably priced at $6. I wish I could come back more often, but it's just out of the way from my neck of the woods. 

Not great for large groups as people tend to linger and there aren't that many tables to sit down at.
author: Patricia Q.

description: Such good service at a little hole in the wall place! I tried the tuna melt and omg, tastes so good! I put some siracha in it per recommendation of the cashier and that made the sandwich even better! The people who work here are super nice and chill and they even have some games to play if you wanna just chill out here. :) i would totally come back here again!
author: Ginah Y.

description:
It's nice to know Arguello has its fair share of little store fronts and even cafes, like this one. 

I like this spot.  It's got Blue Bottle coffee and a cool biker friendly vibe.  Tons of bike racks makes this obvious.  I saw others order food and it looks pretty good even.  At night they host live bands, which I wish I stayed for, but had prior arrangements to tend to.  

I had the macchiato which was tasty so no complaint here.  just gets crowded from time to time, but that just means its a good spot.
author: Vincent K.

description:
Yelp comes through! I needed a brunch spot around the inner richmond and at the last minute decided on Velo Rouge Cafe. Great choice! It's a small corner cafe and was exactly what my friend and I wanted. Although a little crowded when we arrived (around 11:15am), we quickly found a table.  

I've only been here once, but I can tell you we loved our food!

I ordered the Leipheimer Breakfast Burrito. It includes: 2 Eggs scrambled, black beans, potatoes, cheddar cheese, avocado, salsa, & sour cream. You also get a side of chips. Add a little hot sauce and you've got a delicious start to the day.

My friend ordered the McAllister Scramble (3 Eggs scrambled with bacon, mushrooms, onions, spinach, red bell peppers and cheese served on an english muffin).  She asked for only 2 eggs. She loved it.

Prices are pretty reasonable. With both meals and juice we walked out in under $15 for two. It's a nice little cafe on the corner of Arguello and McAllister. You can sit inside or outside depending on the weather - and how busy it is.

If you don't like cold air, I advise sitting away from the front door (if you can). Each time people walk in you get a chilly breath of fresh air.

2-Hour parking is available nearby. We didn't access the WiFi- but saw plenty of people working away.

I will definitely return!
author: Mollie C.

description:
Early birds get the bagel at Velo Rouge Café! I wouldn't want to mosey in around 10 in the morning on a weekend - I think it would be absolutely packed - but early in the morning is great. The space is cute, the staff is friendly. The spicy hummous, which I got on a bagel, is delicious. I wish there were more vegan options, but bagels and hummous are pretty much my jam anyways. 

My omnivorous sweetheart got the breakfast burrito (thumbs up) and I snagged some of the accompanying salsa and chips - the salsa is also delicious. The market on spicy: unexpectedly cornered!
author: Madeleine T.

description: Got the distinct impression that the people running this place think their customers are irritating. Ugh.
author: Ashley H.

description:
This place is amazing and that's an understatement.

Super friendly staff, incredible lattes and food, free wifi... what more could you ask for? Oh, awesome decor, too.

Nice outdoor seating as well, though I hear it's packed on the weekends. Great breakfast burrito. YUM!
author: christine c.

description:
This place is such a cute cafe and I'll definitely drop by again when I'm in the area.  The decorations are awesome--some of the seats are made out of bike parts!  I ended up ordering a pantani (sp?) which was an eggplant, bell peppers, garlic cream cheese etc. sandwich, not to be confused with a panini!  It was super delicious and was rather filling (it came with a side salad too).  I also had a bite of my friend's tuna melt which was also delicious.  I think both dishes were ~7 dollars so it wasn't bad at all.

I only have a few complaints:  it's so freaking popular that it's hard to find seating, though my friends I lucked out.  The food does not come out at the same time, so I'd recommend not waiting for your friend's food otherwise you'll be eating your food cold.

Bottom line:  solid cafe and I would definitely go back...just expect it to be crowded
author: Emily W.

description:
Great service, fast espresso drinks from experienced baristas.

Friendly too.
author: Kyle S.

description: The service was excellent, and the food was awesome. The Jack Johnson banana pancakes were incredible.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Went here with my gf this morning.  Coffee was quite good.  I do like blue bottle, although I don't have the sizzling hot love affair with it that some people do.  GF had tea, and liked it although nothing special.  Chocolate croissant was good, although not that much chocolate.

The coffee bar had simple syrup, which is a BIG plus.  I pretty much exclusively drink iced coffee, so simply syrup is the best way to sweeten it.  Price was also impressive.  Premium iced coffee for like 2.50 I think.  Good deal.

Atmosphere was nice.  Kinda trendy, but not over the top.  Not SUPER loud, but not so quiet it will put you to sleep in the morning.

Overall, will definitely come back here again.  Nothing to complain about.  A great place in the morning!
author: Chris A.

description:
Living one block away, I come here regularly for a quick breakfast/lunch or coffee. Everyone's very friendly, love the atmosphere, and they have excellent food! Definitely recommend the McAllister Scramble!  

On the negative note, my friend has ordered soups from here and it wasn't that good - some tasted like hospital food. There was one occasion where I was given a dirty fork (literally, with brown stains in it).

Overall, great place with a great atmosphere.
author: Nina T.

description: OMG, this places amazing.  I ate a breakfast burrito and it was the best in my whole entire life.  Really, no joke!  Come see for yourself :-)
author: Milad Y.

description:
Velo Rouge might have the best coffee house atmosphere in SF: it's clean (which isn't the case for half the coffee houses in town), rustic, relaxed and has a European flair.  The rust colored walls are adorned with pictures of bicycles and they actually attract cyclists (must be that red bike rack in front of the café and the proximity to Golden Gate Park).  

As a place to get work done, it's decent but there's only 1 working outlet and the café is popular, so you're unlikely to get a table by the outlet.  The wi-fi (free, unsecure) connection wasn't stable either.  

They serve Blue Bottle Coffee, so you know that you're going to get a good cup of coffee.  I had the latte ($3.50) which was exceptionally smooth and bold and the foam even had a pretty leaf design.  

Unfortunately, the latte was on the small side.  I need more caffeine in the morning to get me going.

I also had the breakfast burrito ($6.95) with eggs, cheddar and whole black beans in a grilled tortilla.  The burrito is topped with avocado slices and accompanied by salsa and sour cream.  It was a nice breakfast, a cut above the usual coffee house fare.  I like how the grilled tortilla was a tad crispy.  The small cup of salsa certainly isn't enough for a breakfast burrito.

Breakfast (sandwiches, bagels, pastries, eggs) is served till 2:30 PM.  Lunch (grilled sandwiches) is available after 10:30 AM.  

They have a stamp card (a very cute one) for coffee drinks.
author: Lolia S.

description:
I too took solace at this cafe after a move across the country to San Francisco. The ambiance was charming, and the food was tasty and worthwhile.
